Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: cameroncity
Reviews.Content: The is a very nice hotel with nice rooms which are above standard for large chain hotels. It's very conveniently located for the shops & restaurants - about 5 mins walk from the Crab Pot for man V food fans! Wild Ginger restaurant also highly recommended for delicious Thai food.I've always wanted to see Pike Place Market & the fish throwing vendors - worth seeing definitely, but what amazed me about the market was the fresh flowers & the cherries. Amazing!The seafood stalls are amazing, the chewing gum wall stinking and the overall Seattle experience fantastic. All within 15 minutes walk from the hotel. Would definitely recommend this hotel and would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “What a great Classic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rusty49
Reviews.Content: If you like old classic Hotels that have that "Old Lady" grace, then this is the place. Central to Restaurants and shopping and very easy to get to from Interstate 5, the main North South Freeway which goes through Seattle. Great staff and very welcoming. The valet parking is expensive but all parking in Seattle seems that way. This is a great place to stay on the way through Seattle or for a weekend. The rooms are typical of an older designed Hotel but they have done a great job updating the rooms. Very Classy!!

Reviews.Title: “Not cheap but very nice, touch of service class”
Reviews.Author: JDParker1369
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week on business. Nice hotel, nice rooms right in the heart of downtown and super frinedly staff from doormen, to front desk to waiter/waiteresses. Here is a little story to sum up the experience. On night 3, without any other real interaction with the concierge, we ask him to make a dinner reservation for 8 at the Metropolitan, a famous Seattle steakhouse. He makes the call for us and we head out for a drink and then to the restaurant. After we are seated and looking over the menu, the waiter brings 4 plates of 'American' Kobe beef carpaccio, compliments of the concierge at the Fairmont. Considering we had never been in the hotel before and only had three rooms booked there at a normal rate, I was extremely impressed by the gesture. Also had a good (expensive) breakfast at the hotel and a very good seasfood restaurant (Shuckers) affiliated with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Food allergy ignored!”
Reviews.Author: Danielle1721
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked for a business banquette. Upon arrival, valet and check in staff were GREAT!! Very friendly and knowledgable. However, they upgraded our rooms to a king when I really wanted 2 doubles (2 girls need space to get ready) They couldn't even give us my confirmed room :( Bathroom has no fan. Very very hot and stuffy room. When it came to our dinner party I gave our server my allergy ticket and talked to multiple people to make sure they were aware. I had to ask every course if I could eat it. Every plate was sent back. But the worst part was that my Entree, upon sending my plate back to the waiter, had to wait 3 hours to get my new Entree. But it was my old filet of beef! I was humiliated!! They gave me back my old plate that was now cold. I had then asked for a plate of fruit which I saw someone else got. It arrived 45 minutes later when the coffee was being removed from our table. Went back to our turned down room and the tv didn't work. Had to call the front desk and the tech arrived 40 minutes later and fixed it. The valet was speedy and check out service was excellent. I wrote an email to the manager and have not heard a response. Will NEVER go to this hotel again!! $13 breakfast not included with stay...

Reviews.Title: “This is a SUPERB property - with wonderful, attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: Durodeb
Reviews.Content: We had the great pleasure of staying at this property last weekend. It is a beautiful heritage hotel in a great location downtown. We were upgraded to a suite (because I am a frequent guest at Fairmont properties). It was absolutely lovely and perfect for two couples. The staff were charming and incredibly helpful. Not at all fussy - just kind and welcoming. They gave us great info on things to do (including the Seattle Art Museum which has a great show on at the moment) . Great recommendations on meals as well. There were a couple of errors on the bill which they apologized for profusely and fixed immediately. I would HIGHLY recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Grand downtown hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: andyfromcanada
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 2 nights before flying out of SeaTac on vacation. We ended up with a corner room with classy decorations and a ton of space (i would estimate 400sq ft. in these rooms although they are not technically an upgrade). The check-in process was smooth and efficient. As well, they were later quite helpful in getting my boarding passes printed. The lobby is very spacious and classy and had wonderful piano music playing both nights in the open lounge. I used the fitness facility one day and found it to be fairly well equipped and the hot tub and pool quiet and relaxing. We would defiantly pick this location again as it is very close to Pike place market (10 min. walk) and Pacific Centre shopping (10 min.) as well as many great restaurants (we ate at Elliotts Oyster 4 blocks away and Purple Wine Bar across the street).

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Fairmonts”
Reviews.Author: collmm
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a great stay at the Fairmont in Seattle. We got a deal through hotels.com and it was great value for the money. We got upgraded to a suite and they provided us with a cot and toiletries for our baby. We had a fabulous room service dinner - the lamb rack 3 course meal was very good. The service is superb - all the staff were very friendly, helpful and curteous. The hotel is very close to all the shops and is very central. They have an indoor pool which my husband used with the baby while I was out shopping. We got milk and cookies in our car when we picked it up which was a nice surprise for the journey home. Overall this was a 5 star stay for a 3 star price.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Work Event Location”
Reviews.Author: ahartmann1980
Reviews.Content: I stayed over at the Fairmont Seattle last night and my company hosted a lunch there this afternoon. The room was wonderful, especially large and very comfortable with all of the necessary amenities. I used the gym this morning which had more than enough workout equipment all of which was very up to date. I ordered room-service for breakfast and the food was of excellent quality. Wifi worked perfectly so that I could spend the morning getting some work done (it was free because I'm a President's Club member, not sure how affordable it was to pay for). Before noon, I went down to the luncheon and found that the room was set up very well. We have had roadshows across the country and this was one of the best spaces. I had to leave early and the kitchen was able to provide a boxed lunch. An excellent stay! My only complaint was that the heat/ac was fairly dated and it was somewhat difficult to change the temp.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Place”
Reviews.Author: Mona B
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this elegant established hotel. Booking thru AmEx we got a fantastic upgrade to a suite and comps for dinner and breakfast. We enjoyed the meals in the both of the nice restaurants. Service was great. Close to the museum where we saw the Gauguin Exhibit and to Pikes Market, the hotel is located perfectly. We didn't do too much exploring because of the weather, but we will definitely stay there again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTraveler967
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night for a business meeting. Nice room, good food, and convenient location. This is a grand hotel from the gilded age. Staff were helpful, friendly, and good service. It reminds me of a smaller version of the Waldorf Astoria in New York. Noisy room next to traffic on a low floor. Next time I will ask for a quieter one. I would definitely come back again, though.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot sustain the laurels it rests on”
Reviews.Author: doctort
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel for over 25 years - but it is no longer worth staying here. There are other hotels that you will get more service for the money you spend, and this hotel is just not worth it. The rooms are small for a luxury hotel, and AMEX does not mean you get upgraded. They don't child proof the rooms. They don't honor the Four Square deals (of course Four Square is a joke anyway, but still, really, quibble over an appetizer give away?). This was a great property once- it is no longer.

Reviews.Title: “First class Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: DCGuy1414
Reviews.Content: The hotel is gorgeous and historic, my room was super spacious, and the staff was incredibly gracious. The gym is one of the nicest hotel gyms I've been to, and they give you unlimited ice cold water bottles and coffee in the mornings -- a huge incentive to get out of bed and hit the gym before your day starts. Great location, beautiful hotel, and friendly, professional staff. Couldn't ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay In A Great Location”
Reviews.Author: redranamber
Reviews.Content: Stayed @ The Fairmont Olympic last week for 5 nights. The hotel is in a great location, minutes away from the waterfront and within walking distance of a lot of the attractions and shopping districts. The rooms themselves are spotless and very comfortable, the retro decor adds to the ambience. The only (minor, I must stress) gripe we had about the place is that some of the reception staff could do with being a little friendlier and more courteous. We were well looked after in general here but found one or two working in this area were a little on the cool side, which takes a little of the gloss off the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Little dated and still charging for Internet”
Reviews.Author: PlasticSack
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a suite in the Olympic fairmont whilst having a long weekend in Seattle with the family taking in a Seahawks game. Hotel was a little dated and needs renovation, not up to the standard of other fairmont properties I have stayed at, though to be fair they were renovating some of the floors while we were there. No coffee making facilities in the room and only one coffee shop in pop out range. And charging $25 a day for Internet is unbelievable in this day and age. Nice location, and the great service you would expect from the fairmont hotels. Ok if expensive dining in the hotel. Disappointing for fairmont to be honest.

Reviews.Title: “Another Fairmont 5* Amazing Experience”
Reviews.Author: LeTerrible
Reviews.Content: I am a Priority Club/Ambassador/Intercontinetal Person. Always will be. The exception is the wonderful hotels of the Fairmont group that has yet to disappoint. I have written a wonderful review for the amazing Fairmont in Vancouver, Boston and Washington DC and now....this true gem of a 'Super 5* luxe experience'. The hotel, itself, is stunning. If you love to have a drink in a beautiful setting, come down to the lobby and order a 'coupe de champagne' and enjoy the wonderful ambiance. The Two restaurants are tops for dinner, the 'Oyster Bar Schuckers' being more oak-room casual and just delicious. The main Restaurant, 'The Georgian', is one of the most beautiful in Seattle and one of the best for 'haute cusine'. The foie Gras served with a chutney of puree of apricot and cinnamon was incredible and the Duck in 5 spices was just as good, The breakfast in this same lovely dining room can't be beat and the servers, especially John at beakfast, were warm, 'on point' when you needed them and just an example of what I found in my experiences with the entire staff. FYI, Penny gave me one of the best massages that I've had in months and the spa employees and ambiance is just Superb We were upgraded to a jr Executive suite as we are "President Club Members' (you get free wifi and late checkout just for joining as a base level member), and it could not have been more lovely. Double doors between the bedroom and the sitting area. Amazing bed with fine, Egyptian linens and Goose down comforters. All the 5* ammenities you would expect were found in the room..and more. Lovely, sparkling bathroom with very nice samples and a sumptous tub. Clean? Every inch of this hotel just gleams. I can't go on how the combination of this lovely room and the warm but professional staff made this stay so perfect. I find this is true at most Fairmonts but this was the 'best' of the best. Prices are not outrageous for such a wonderful experience. Perhaps it is the history of this fine hotel combined with all these other factors. If you are looking to have a special visit to Seattle , this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant & welcoming”
Reviews.Author: lianamurphyjd
Reviews.Content: I just love this hotel -if you like English style elegance-come here -it is like the country lady -warm cozy yet the Georgian restaurant has some of the most innovative menu presentations I have seen ! the executive chef has some wonderful meals -the afternoon tea while not quite up to The Empress in Victoria is stll delightful. Shuckers seafood restaurant is fun and like an old pub --the Terrace lounge charming & the Classic champagne cocktail is great! Had the Executive suite -nice sitting room & separate bedroom .

Reviews.Title: “Fast elevators!”
Reviews.Author: Purrplehelmet
Reviews.Content: Was there for banquet. Food in the Garden was just OK. Lots of micro brew beer but nothing domestic. Rooms and view were awesome. Staff was great! My employer paid for rooms and I'm not sure of the cost but I'm sure it was a good value. Everything I wanted was within walking distance?

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel”
Reviews.Author: 124kross
Reviews.Content: I stayed a week at the Fairmont. The service was fine but the building is older withy he decor and challenges of it's age. Hot water is not always immediately available, although the saff was kind and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “A first class hotel in a great Seattle location”
Reviews.Author: Tripdaddy2
Reviews.Content: This is an elegant hotel with an "old world" but stylish feel to it. We stayed in an "executive suite" on the 11the floor overlooking the front entry of the hotel. The room was wonderful and what you would expect from a Fairmont Hotel. The staff here go the extra mile to make you feel like you are someone very important. I would also recommend the pool and fitness center which are also "first class" like everything else in the hotel. We had Sunday brunch in The Georgia room, which is a great big dining hall with a palatial feel to it. The brunch though, was only just "ok" for the price at $25 per person. Seattle is a dining mecca though, and there are many excellent dining options just steps from this great hotel. My only other complaint was a charge of $1.69 for a local call which is an irritant even on a $300 bill for the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Still a grand dame hotel in every way.”
Reviews.Author: bulldogNYC
Reviews.Content: Wonderful old-world decor with modern conveniences and terrific service. I love a psh older hotel, and the Olympic delivers in every regard. The elegant, spacious lobby is everything a modern corporate hotel aspires to be - a great place to read with a cup f tea, a grand yet welcoming public space. Our room was handsome, with a nice view up 5th Avenue. Nicely appointed with a lovely bath that had everything one needed or wanted. The parking valets came up with our car in seconds, and always asked if we needed directions. Small touches, but always appreciated. I would happily stay here on any future trip to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Seattle's Best”
Reviews.Author: Footloose1953
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Olympic is a fantastic hotel in the old, grand style. When you think of hotels from the early 1900's, you think of appointments that are a little shabby at best but at the Fairmont Olympic, that's just not the case. Everything is first-rate as far as being kept up and the idea of service to the guests is apparently drilled into the staff. One staff member saw me headed toward an elevator so she deviated from her path to beat me to the elevator door and asked me if she should press "up or down, sir?" Are you kidding me? I just don't expect that sort of thing for any price these days. The spa is great, the Georgian dining room is fantastic for dinner and brunch, Shuckers restaurant on the lower level is great for seafood lovers. There are cheaper sleeps and eats in Seattle but none better.

Reviews.Title: “consistently great”
Reviews.Author: jeo
Reviews.Content: Service is excellent. Food is great. Rooms are clean. 6th time at this hotel with our children, always a pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Family0fTravelers_5
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this location multiple times with our 3 girls. The hotel is top notch, service is fabulous! It is walking distance from downtown shopping, restaurants & hot spots.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience--exceptional service!”
Reviews.Author: richardanddolly
Reviews.Content: It doesn't get any better than this! Our Executive King Suite was spacious and the bed was extremely comfortable. Our room was immaculate and well appointed. The location was great. We appreciated the hotel car to take us to a downtown restaurant for dinner. The driver was courteous and graciously picked us up after dinner. As a member of the President's Club the free wireless and complimentary workout wear was an added bonus. We made use of the exceptional gym and were greeted warmly by the courteous staff. We would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “An amazing experience - great location and staff!”
Reviews.Author: JHarris_9
Reviews.Content: Wow, right from our arrival at the Fairmont it wa top notch. The location is great for down town Seattle. The valet parking was great and these guys are first class. The rooms are spacious and very clean and comfortable. All the bedding and toiletries are good. This is a place where every attention has been paid to detail. All the staff act like they own a piece of the hotel, they were friendly and helpful. The gym was very good with good equipment. There was a nice pool, hot tub and sauna and the change rooms had were stocked with everything you'd need. Nice touch in the gym with all the towels and bottled water. The breakfast was superb. The buffet had lots of fresh fruit, blackberries, blueberries, mango, raspberries, papaya and cereals, yogurts and hot breakfast. The ambience and elegance of this hotel is worth experiencing. I can't say enough about the staff who are exceptionally well trained and attentive. Very serene, classy and elegant without being stuffy. Congrats fairmont Seattle! I'd defintely recommend this hotel as a great place to stay to visit Seattle, or have a great getaway. Shuckers restaurant was also good. Well prepared food and good ambience!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel and location!”
Reviews.Author: oahulady66
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent business traveler and stayed at the Fairmont Olympic 2 nights Feb 29 and Mar 1. The rooms were very big with a superbly comfortable bed. My view wasn't great, but I wasn't there for that (view of buildings across the way, no water from my room at least). The work desk was okay - not huge, but decent with one plug nearby. The room had an armchair with a little table as well, a minibar, coffee and such, a big closet with hooks and a small safe (in which I couldn't fit my big laptop). The bathroom was a big size with a separate room/door for shower and toilet. The toiletries were nice and there was a bathrobe, and a nice extra of two sets of slippers - that's very rare. Room service was quick and good - I had a turkey club with fries and all was hot/cold where supposed to be; it came delivered on a rolling table instead of a tray, which I always think is a nice touch. Everyone was extremely helpful - fast check-in, email my check-out folio, called a cab quickly, directed me on the walk to my business meeting, etc. Capitol Grille is right across the street for finer dining, and there seemed to be some places nearby for quicker and less expensive meals. All in all, I thought it was a great hotel and I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “top of the line”
Reviews.Author: Jake B
Reviews.Content: we stayed and enjoyed, service was above and beyond. if you are a novice traveler, it's nice to have know that that some places are just outstanding, when we travel back to seattle, it's the only place we will stay

Reviews.Title: “Just beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Crisjoy1
Reviews.Content: All was perfect for our overnight musical get-away! The hotel is so lovely! The dessert in the restaurant was over the top! The thermostat/heat made sleep tough for me but all else was PERFECT!

Reviews.Title: “FELLS LIKE HOME - AMAZING HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Eduardo S
Reviews.Content: It was my moms 60th Birthday and I flew her out from Brazil to Vancouver, and took a trip to Seattle. We decided to stay at the Fairmont as they have great service ( I stayed in other Fairmont Hotels and it was amazing) The service starting from the Vallet to the front desk and room service is just amazing. You feel like home and I didn't want to leave the place.. They called me by my name and that is HUGE for me ; ) The concierge was so pleased and happy to help. Thanks to William and Mario you guys made a HUGE difference on my trip... I can't thank you enough!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECTION & PAMPERING”
Reviews.Author: CanadaRover
Reviews.Content: My cousin and stayed here to celebrate our 50th Birthdays and the hotel service was above and beyond my expectations (and I stay in Fairmonts frequently)!. The front desk staff were incredible in helping us select the perfect executive suite and even sent us a tray of chocolate dipped strawberries to mark the occasion! We enjoyed riding in the chauffeur driven Jaguar and the professional chauffeurs and doormen who consistently made us feel like royalty. We went swimming and enjoyed a pool long enough to swim lengths as well as a fantastic hot tub. The locker rooms were very nicely appointed and clean. Our room was very pretty with a pretty light green colour scheme and crystal lamps. Joining the President's Club provides you with many benefits including complementary internet and the loan of work out runners and clothes. Lovely stay - we'll definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “A Curate's Egg of a Hotel - good in parts”
Reviews.Author: hungryperson
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairmont for one night this week as part of a large group travelling on business. Check-in was very slow because we all arrived in a bunch but they didn't put more people on the desk to deal with it nor did they have our room keys ready in advance. I was put into a small room on the second floor next to the swimming pool and lifts so there was quite a bit of through traffic in the corridor outside and a really lousy view of a flat roof and some litter outside. Not a big deal for one night but not terribly luxurious either. I was slightly irked that the guy in the line in front of me got a top floor corner room with lovely views and the guy behind me got upgraded to a suite because of the wait at check in. I know because they were both in my party and were obviously delighted with the outcome and told us all. I obviously drew the short straw. The room was fine, clean, well-appointed. The air conditioning unit in my room was too noisy to leave on and the one from the room next door was also very noisy and I didn't get a great night's sleep as a result. But It's pretty astonishing to have to pay for internet connectivity these days and $8 for a bottle of water from the minibar is also pretty outrageous. In the last year I've stayed at Raffles, Four Seasons, Ritz Carlton etc. and I'm pretty sure I didn't have to pay for water or internet at any of them. My colleagues tell me that their rooms had an espresso machine but mine did not, which is a shame. This is an increasingly common amenity. So, what was good? Breakfast was fantastic. Really tasty omelette, nice buffet. The lobby is pretty impressive. I'm told (ahem!) that the views from the higher floors are nice. The bathroom is shiny and marble and the room compares well with other luxury hotels in terms of amenities and comfort. The location is good and central. They did a great shoe shine!

Reviews.Title: “The Fairmont- Service Above & Beyond The Rest!”
Reviews.Author: John_t_payne
Reviews.Content: My wife was celebrating a milestone birthday so we headed to Seattle 2-9-12 for an evening at the Fairmont Olympic Hotel. From the time we arrived the service, attention to detail and quality around us was incredible. Due to the occassion they up-graded our room at no extra charge. From the 9th floor we had a great view of the Emerald city, Pikes Place and the Puget Sound. We enjoyed happy hour in their Terrace lounge and upon returning to the room they delivered us chocolate dipped strawberries with Happy Birthday drizzled in chocolate as well. An incredible value at $159 (Winter Saver deal _ Tax, etc). I recommend it 100%!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: shredbetti
Reviews.Content: I am already a huge Fairmont fan, I have stayed with Fairmont hotel many times. BUT this Fairmont Olympic is soooo gorgeous! I love the openness of the lobby and the terrace. The decor is exactly what they state on their website "Italian Renaissance". Also, the indoor pool and hot-tub, and fitness room is super clean and calming. I also love this location - you can walk to all downtown shopping, Belltown, Pike Place, and the piers. We made use of the "house car" as well for some of the longer distances. They drivers and doormen were always more than helpful and making sure we were safe. (Deion especially). Everyone including the front desk and maid service were amazing! I highly recommend this property and I will only stay here while in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: diane16523
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at this hotel the. The staff was great, the room was great. I will definitely return in the future and recommend this hotel to anyone. THanks for the hospitality!!

Reviews.Title: “Ok stay in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Jmmaurer219
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great central location. They have beautiful common areas. The rooms are a little small and Spartan. The beds were very firm, borderline uncomfortable. If you like firm beds, you'll be ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: HikerGirl101
Reviews.Content: The condition of the room is what all hotels should strive for: clean, neat, everything working, and modernized. The 11th floor deluxe room was silent (thank you!) and the bed comfy. I slept with the windows open and had no trouble with the traffic. The common areas on the 11th floor and the room showed some wear so I was surprised it was one of the renovated floors. The valet did explain the Flower Show self-park discount for which I was grateful as I planned to pay for valet. One problem was no one at the front desk explained how the self park worked ... even when I handed one of them the key for the room which is needed to get out of the garage.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful property in the heart of Seattle”
Reviews.Author: carrieryan
Reviews.Content: We travel to Seattle 4 or 5 times a year for a weekend getaway, and stayed at the Fairmont for the first time on this trip. It is a lovely property- very stately and decadent and keeping with the Fairmont tradition. The room was fantastic- very spacious and well laid-out with all the amenities you could ask for. What I loved is that when we checked in at 10pm, the valet had our room keys and check-in completed so we were able to head directly to the room. A wonderful touch and very much appreciated on a later arrival. What I didn't love was the Terraces bar was understaffed, and the service was not to the level we would expect. What I was incredibly disappointed in was the $42 per night for parking. I could have left my car at a number of neighboring hotels and paid $10-15 less without being a guest. That was absolutely atrocious, and will greatly impact our decision to stay there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance in center city”
Reviews.Author: GeorgePortland_OR
Reviews.Content: No false notes here, from friendly doormen to swift check-in to lovely (upgraded) room. There are three restaurants/cafe within the building: the lovely Georgian Room for breakfast, lunch, or dinner; a very good cafe with excellent pastries for breakfast fare on the lower level; and Shuckers, an oyster bar/pub, also on the lower level. I tried all three and found service and food very good, though, with the exception of the cafe, on the pricey side. The upgraded room was an elegant junior suite--two large rooms, large bath, plenty of closet space, minibar, desk, sofa, chairs, two TVs, etc. Very comfortable for reading, with good lighting and easily accessible electrical plugs for rechargers--something often overlooked by hotels. The Fairmont Olympic is a beautifully refurbished older hotel of considerable elegance, located about 4 blocks from the Convention Center, two blocks from the new and spectacular Seattle Public Library, and three blocks from the Seattle Art Museum. It is well situated for shopping and has some of Seattle's most elegant stores within the complex. I booked in connection with the Northwest Flower and Garden Show and got a great rate (plus the unexpected upgrade). Check for deals.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and impeccable service staff”
Reviews.Author: Love-Maui-101
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Fairmont Olympic Hotel in Seattle, Washington on several occasions. The hotel itself has been refurbished and is very clean but our room was on the small side. The bathroom was right next to the bed which seemed odd and you had to close the bathroom door before you could enter the small doorway area where the toilet was. The arrangement was not the best. Also, there was only one "sitting chair" unless you wanted to use the hard, straight back chair with the desk so only one of you had a comfortable chair for reading, watching TV, etc. However, the hotel is very conveniently located so you can walk to shopping, restaurants and theatres. The bed was very comfortable. The staff is very accomodating and customer service gets an A+. They extended our checkout time without hesitation. A nice place to stay for a short visit.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star at 4 star prices - great location, food and staff”
Reviews.Author: DoctorFeelgoodDorset
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fairmont Olympic for week long Conference. The Fairmont Olympic is in downtown Seattle, between 4th and 5th Avenue. It was built in 1924 and was previously the Four Seasons Olympic Hotel. Location is great with a 5 min walk to the water front and main shopping arcades. It has grand entrance area, large lobby and plenty of friendly and helpful staff. Rooms are a reasonable size but not all have yet been updated. There is no double glazing so rooms on front tend to be noisy from 6am onwards. Some rooms have glimpses of surrounding mountains and Puget SOund. Did not eat in the the Georgian restaurant but the Conference food was varied and very good. There is also the slightly less formal Shuckers in the basement. Breakfast is pricey at $27 but you can eat as well in the Belle Epicurean in the arcade or cheaply nearby in Starbucks. The Spa and health centre is well equipped and there is a business centre bizarrely on the 12th floor. It has a presidential suite and indeed Jimmy Carter stayed during the conference week! There are "town cars" including an XJ12 Jaguar which will take you around town free-of-charge on a first come first served basis. Slight minus points - no on site rental cars (but there is an Alamo in nearby Hilton), you can only drop off or wait for 10 mins, valet parking is expensive, wifi is not free and drinks in the bar are expensive. Conference Room Rate for a deluxe room was $160 vs $220 full rate.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Hotel & Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: Mark O
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a modern, trendy hotel this one's probably not for you. But if you love old-world charm, elegance and great service then you'll love the Fairmount Olympic. The lobby is beautiful, the rooms are quite nice, the gym is adequate and the hotel staff is more than accomodating. We really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay with my daughter”
Reviews.Author: travel0937
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here and had a wonderful expereince. Walking distance to the movie theatre and we had roomservice, high tea, and walked to a few malls and general sights. What fun!

Reviews.Title: “If you want classy it just doesn't get any better than this.”
Reviews.Author: Sara_and_Daniel
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont chain is noted for their historic properties in world class destinations. What we experienced this weekend at the Seattle property was much more than a nice location in a well maintained grand building. It was service and embracing as a guest we rarely, if ever have tasted the likes of before. From the moment we arrived to the shutting of the car doors by the doorman our interactions with the staff of this property were exceptional. Never did we feel like the great service was contrived or put on. It was warm, engaging, thoughtful and delicate. We also had an over the top experience at The Georgian which is a review unto itself. Food, service and atmosphere on a true grand fine dining level. I highly recommend taking it all in at least once, but I also think that once you do you will be back for more. It just that great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service”
Reviews.Author: ckccan
Reviews.Content: First stay at this property and used a free night coupon in combination with a suite upgrade, and added an additional night. This hotel is in the middle of the CBD so in the immediate vicinity, it was very quiet and "closed" when I arrived Friday evening. However, only a few blocks away from Pike Place market, so a central location. There is no Fairmont gold floor here, and the suite was more what I would call a jr. suite. They did offer me the option to pay additional for a deluxe suite, or considerably more for a corner suite. I chose neither, as the room I had was on a high floor and recently renovated. The room itself was reminiscent of grandmother's house in terms of furniture and decoration, but comfortable and tasteful. The bath tub was tiny, french doors of sorts separated the small living area from the small bedroom. Went to Shuckers which is within the hotel and had fantastic oysters and even better oysters rockefeller. Be warned that parking (valet seemed only reasonably easy option) is $42 a day. Nice touch that they put a container of milk and cookies in my vehicle when I checked out! All in all, good service, pleasant stay, great location, nothing spectacular, but no complaints either!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, historic property with modern touches, great service”
Reviews.Author: 2deer
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Olympic lives up to the high standard of service found in Fairmont hotels. A historic property in downtwon Seattle, the hotel is close to many of the downtown tourist spots and business. Though an older porperty, it is in great condition and has been upgraded to fit modern business needs. The health club and business center are very good. Like most first class business hotels, they do have the annoying habit of charging for internet, water, parking - and at high rates. But this is the industry habit not theirs.

Reviews.Title: “Location...Location...Location!”
Reviews.Author: ClickChick
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Olympic was the perfect choice for our first visit to Seattle as it was within walking distance to tourist attractions (Pike Place Market, Seattle Public Library, Art Gallery), shopping, restaurants, entertainment and public transportation. Our room was a pristine and spacious two room suite and although the decor was not to my taste, the bath fixtures and room furniture are in superior condition. Initially I was concerned by the room's proximity to the elevators, but we were not at all disturbed by noise. We also experienced outstanding service from the Fairmont's courteous and friendly staff who went out of their way to make our stay in Seattle most enjoyable. We took advantage of the drop off/pick up car service to local restaurants which was much more comfortable and less expensive than taking a cab. Although we did not eat in any of the hotel restaurants, we enjoyed delicious half price appetizers during happy hour in the lobby bar after spending the day at EMP. On our last day, we purchased some wonderful savoury and sweet pastries from the bakery downstairs as it is a far better alternative to airport/plane food.

Reviews.Title: “A gorgeous old property marred by poorly trained staff”
Reviews.Author: mmcgown
Reviews.Content: Truly a lovely property, the Olympic Hotel has been well maintained by its owners. Sadly, some Fairmont staffers need a lesson in courtesy. When I asked the concierge about a limo to the airport, she said she'd have to call one and get a price quote. I thought this odd since the concierge dispatches limos daily. She said the price would be higher because of the snow and then proceeded to defend this practice loudly, to the astonishment of a nearby guest and myself. Since airport limos are flat rate, and since she then recommended that I take a metered cab if I wanted a flat rate, I thought she needed better training before staffing a concierge desk. Later in the day, I asked the front desk clerk for a copy of my bill to ensure it was in order before the morning checkout. There was a restaurant charge that was not mine, as I don't sign room tabs. I told the clerk this and showed my charge record receipts for my meals. He insisted that it must have been something I forgot and immediately called the restaurant manager to the front desk. A third clerk entered the fray, and the three of them cross examined me in the lobby about my bad memory. But they couldn't produce a signed ticket. I thought the correct procedure would have been to remove the charge immediately, apologize, and then find the ticket. Of course, when they found it two hours later, it was for another room, and the damage had been done. There were other very fine employees, notably Rick the bellman and Joanne in the Executive Lounge, as well as waiters John and Sean in the Georgian Room. But it only takes one adverse encounter to mar a stay, and I had two. That's two too many for a hotel with Fairmont in its name.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Service”
Reviews.Author: 66HappyTrvlr
Reviews.Content: Last minute change of plans caused me to stay overnight in Seattle earlier in the Winter. I got a great rate by calling the front desk rather late at night. Check in was smooth and I was impressed that the valet who took my car communicated with the front desk so that by the time I went upstairs to check-in they were expecting me. The room was spacious, albeit a tiny bit dated, and very comfortable. The exceedingly comfortable bed and soft sheets were welcomed by this tired traveller. The bathroom towels were not quite as soft but I recognize that is rather difficult to do in a hotel setting. Although I do not recall the brand, the bathroom products (i.e. shower gel, shampoo, etc.) were fantastic. I am a real snob when it comes to products and I really liked these. I ordered room service late night and the service was fast and polite. The food was very good but not outstanding. Like most room service, it was a bit pricey. Free wi-fi made up for the cost of room service though. Some draw backs are that the hallways are long and a lot of the views are not very desirable. But any negatives were overcome by the extraordinary way that the staff handled a problem that I had. I got a sudden onset of the flu or some kind of stomach bug. This may be too much information but I vomited on the floor. Embarrassed as I was, I called housekeeping to report the problem. They handled it with such tact that I felt comfortable. They not only sent someone up within minutes to clean up my mess but they also sent up pepto and asked if I needed anything else. I really felt like they took care of me. This is not the kind of service you would find at a Hyatt or a Westin or the like. They really stood out to me as expertly trained staff and I thank them for this.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and old world charm”
Reviews.Author: Mr_RN
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed 3 nights at the Fairmont Olympic for business. First impression is that the hospital is very early-century chic. Although a horrible analogy, in many ways I feel like I have boarded the Titanic (in a good, non-sinking way). There is opulence everywhere but it isn’t over stated. When entering the lobby the first thing you notice is that it is 2 stories (main level and mezzanine level). Check in was very quick (I called the night before so that I could check in at 7:30 am) and I had no problems. In fact, I was upgraded (complimentary) to a deluxe executive suite. That makes a good first impression. When I entered the room, I was surprised to see a sitting room. Off to the side of the sitting room is the bedroom with king bed (separated by French doors). There is a flat screen TV in the bedroom and one in the sitting room. The sitting room has a chair, sofa bed, desk/chair, end table, and “refreshment center.” The mini bar is definitely fully stocked with 18 small bottles of liquor, a bottle of wine, bottle of champagne, some beer, some juice, some water, and some soda as well as candy, cookies, and chips. Beware, however, the minibar isn’t cheap. A liter bottle of water is $8.00. The entry way holds the closet (with safe) and a chest of drawers. There is an umbrella and robes in the closet. Also in the closet is an ironing board. The bathroom (next to the entry) is well appointed with marble countertops/floors. I like the scale in the bathroom. The shower is a tub/shower combo. I found the bed to be very comfortable and it seemed as if there were two types of pillows on the bed, both firm and soft. There was a simple alarm clock next to the bed. On the first evening, I awoke at midnight to a soft beeping sound. I thought that an alarm in an adjacent room must be going off. It sounded strangely close, however and I realized that it was coming from the sitting room. There is a “sound machine” radio with alarm in there and the alarm had been left “on” for midnight. Lesson learned – always check all alarms. The hotel staff are amazing and very accommodating. Everyone says hello and several have called the elevator as I was approaching. The food has been excellent (privately catered in The Garden), although the meals were constructed somewhat oddly (Green beans, salad, pasta, and 5 kinds of meat just seemed a little too Atkins). The “health club” is very large with dressing rooms for both men and women. The dressing room has individual showers and lockers. There are 3 ellipticals, 6 treadmills, a stair climber, and a recumbent bike in one room and the other contains free weights as well as some universal equipment. Each piece of cardio equipment has its own TV/DVD. Just ask for headphones at the health club desk. The desk also has complimentary water Just on the other side of a glass wall is the swimming pool and spa. The staff can be seen bringing beverages and food to people poolside. From a business meeting perspective, be aware that it can be a bit noisy at times. If you are in a large room, the food and beverages are in the room with you. Every time the staff come in to refresh your drinks, they will be stacking coffee cups or adding ice to the bowls holding the drinks. It can get a bit annoying after a while. This is a very minor complaint. If you happen to be in one of their smaller meeting rooms, the food and beverages are kept outside of the room so this isn’t an issue. All in all, I had a great experience. The staff were always accommodating. The hotel is in need of some renovations (not because it “looks” bad, just to get it a bit more up to date). For example, the thermostat in my room was probably 30 years old. One would expect something a little more sophisticated than a dial. There is some wear and tear noted. However, there is nothing screaming that it needs repaired. As previous reviews noted, the hotel is centrally located so there is easy access to many of Seattle’s best attractions. If I could rate 4.5 stars, I would as it isn’t quite what I have experienced at a location such as the Ritz, however it is still an excellent property. I would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Cajunkaren
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Fairmont over Thanksgiving and had a grand time. We booked a good deal at Fairmont.com and stayed in one of their suites. We arrived in the middle of the night (around 1 am b/c we were coming in from Anchorage) and everyone was very friendly. They have a great locally owned coffee shop in the hotel and the rooms are a nice size. I go to Seattle frequently and try to stay at the waterfront... I wasn't sure what to expect about the location but it was spot-on. Walking distance to everything. We didn't have a car and that was perfect. Our son is three so the main reason we booked the Fairmont was for the pool and it was magnificent. Great, clean and organized area. We had lunch there a couple of time and coffee one morning. We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “splendid”
Reviews.Author: mountainmay
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Fairmont for a conference --but it turned into a holiday! The hotel is very lovely. We had a corner room on the 11th floor, and could see the bay. The spa /gym was 'sybaritic - and the location superb. I hope we can return

Reviews.Title: “What more could you ask for?”
Reviews.Author: KiwiExplorer87
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this beautiful hotel! Couldn't fault a thing, there's not much more to say! We particularly liked the festive decorations :)

Reviews.Title: “Great pool and health club”
Reviews.Author: Pat_e321
Reviews.Content: This is the only hotel my husband and I go to over and over again. The beds are comfortable, the service is superb and the pool is the loveliest spot in Seattle in winter. You can put your shoes out at night and in the morning they are polished and shined- gratis. The only thing that we have problems with is the room service food. We no longer order room service because twice our order was incorrect and the food was not worth the price. There is a great little breakfast place a few blocks away where we got food and brought it to the room. There are great deals on this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “dingy chic in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: Mike_J1963
Reviews.Content: close to shops and the waterfront, very reliable access to restaurants and theatres; good solid hotel, very good service

Reviews.Title: “Good Service, Outdated Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dandrew
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Olympic both at the beginning of our trip for three days and for two at the end. The hotel offers a central location close to many of the popular attractions in seattle. I would recommend going to the public library it is just around the corner and was worth seeing. The hotel itself is very historic, but is in need of a facelift. The lobby is built in a 1920's grand hotel style with plenty of seating. The rooms are large and offer decent amenities but it is obvious that the furniture is old and the decor is from the 1990s. My dad has stayed at the hotel numerous times and loves its location but he told me that it has not been renovated in the time that he has been there and he has stayed there for the past decade and a half. The hotel was a former four seasons so it has that same old style decor. The gym is big but again the equipment looks as though it is from the 90's and the pool looks as though it hasn't been cleaned since the 90's. Overall the Olympic is in my opinion the best hotel in Seattle because of its close proximity to many of seattle's most famous attractions and the excellent quality of service.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous service”
Reviews.Author: Anneliese8
Reviews.Content: I don't know how such a big and busy hotel manages it, but the service at this place is off the charts. Every single person I encountered in my stay here made me feel welcome--kind, friendly, accommodating, and I had some out-there requests, such as last minute photocopies for a business meeting, getting a boarding pass after I'd already checked out, strange check-out times because interviews I was doing ran late. They didn't just get me what I needed, they did it with generosity and smiles. Wow. They are just doing it right at this place--the room felt luxurious, the spa was really well maintained--it is the kind of place that anticipates your needs and caters to them seamlessly. I can only add that the bar and restaurant are superb, with a gracious clubby feeling that also makes you feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “An historic hotel that doesn't feel like a carbon copy”
Reviews.Author: ProfessorEnglish
Reviews.Content: This used to be the Olympic; another time was the Four Seasons. As part of the growing Fairmont chain this beautifully refurbished hotel goes out of its way to help visitors relax and quickly feel known and welcome. Very spacious and open, multi-leveled lobby leading up to a beautiful dining room. Cozy bar and inventive drinks. Excellent spa with good swimming pool and hot tub; massage room; sauna. Staff is uniformly gracious and proactive in anticipating guests' needs. House car available for short trips, first-come first-served. Very well located; five blocks from Pike Place; two blocks from convention center. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, caring employees”
Reviews.Author: wurldtravler
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful four night stay at the Fairmont in Seattle. I was there for work and originally booked for three nights. Unfortunately I became ill overnight on my last night there from food poisoning from a local restaurant (not one of the ones at the Fairmont!). Being sick alone in a hotel room far from home is no fun, but everyone at the Fairmont went totally above and beyond to make me as comfortable as possible. Everyone I interacted with was very caring--the bellman who brought me some pepto-bismol from the gift shop below, the housekeeper to whom I apologized profusely (and tipped what I hope was generously enough) when she had to clean up the bathroom which was in not such a nice state after my illness, and everyone else whom I dealt with as I was recovering. The "Royal Service" agent who assisted me on the phone was helpful first with my request for a late checkout and then, when I realized I was not going to recover in time to make my afternoon flight, arranged for me to stay in the room for another night, charging the same (low) group rate that I'd had for my original booking. They even surprised me with a complimentary bowl of soup as I recovered--just what I needed. All of this gave me a very positive feeling about the employees and their care and attentiveness towards their guests. Even before that I had really enjoyed my time at the Fairmont--very pleasant and well-appointed complimentary health club and pool and nicely decorated rooms with curtains that overlap to provide a true "blackout" for a good night's sleep. The decor style is classic and old-fashioned--if that doesn't appeal to you then you won't be at home here but I loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont Seattle - princess for a day”
Reviews.Author: DebBAuburn_WA
Reviews.Content: For that last 10 years or so we have spent a night or 2 in the city to celebrate a birthday or the holidays. Our hotel of choice has always been the Fairmont. I always feel like a princess in this hotel. No wonder, as he staff treats their guests like royalty. The hotel is beautifully appointed: the rooms, hallways and lobby all reek of old money. We love the lobby area and sampling one of their famous martinis. Yes, this is an expensive hotel, but you do get your money’s worth. There is some good news for those of you who are watching your dollars these days – we certainly are. We joined the Fairmont’s President’s Club – its free. They email you when there are special rates offered around the world. We took advantage of this great rate for our stay this December. If you like seafood, you can’t go wrong with Schucker’s. Also, there is good happy hour in the lobby and bar with reasonably priced drinks and snacks. Treat yourself – your deserve it!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: caycay_can
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough good things about the hotel - probably my favourite stay of the year. Great service from the concierge desk, who provided a fantastic wine bar and a great spa recommendation. Rooms were lovely, well appointed and large. Very clean and well maintained. Room service was fantastic. Easy to get to many of the locations in downtown Seattle - Pike's Place and the Seattle Art Museum are close by.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Ask for Renovated Room.”
Reviews.Author: Charlie827
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in April for 3 nights, checked out for 1 night, then checked back in for another 3 nights. During our first three nights, our room was spacious with a newly renovated bathroom and large living area. The hotel is in a great location in downtown Seattle and the staff was very helpful in directing us about town. When we checked back in, however, we were checked into one of the old rooms, which was smaller and very disappointing compared to our first room. We called the front desk to ask to be transferred to another updated suite, and they accommodated us immediately. What great service! And what a difference in rooms! The complimentary breakfast each morning was amazing - just be sure to ask what is included in the complimentary breakfast and don't order beyond that if you're on a budget because they charge you an arm and a leg for the extras ($7 for a grapefruit!!)...but overall our stay was excellent and would definitely go back if we have to go to Seattle again in the future. Also, we took advantage of the pool, hot tub, and gym and that was very nice. Great to work out in the freezing weather and they had an excellent massage therapist for a reasonable price too.

Reviews.Title: “what you pay is what you get”
Reviews.Author: popskunk
Reviews.Content: Hotel is well located, in downtown Seattle and has a good and helpfull staff, worth the price. i would return with no doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Classic in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: bigGNorthVancouver
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Fairmont Christmas eve. The hotel was quiet but the service was first rate. The location was excellent and central o everything close to the stadium as we were therento see the Seahawks. Had the Christmas buffet at the Georgian restaurant which was half buffet half ala carte. It was truly great and the service again was top notch. Upon checking out the the valet placed chocolate chip cookies on the seat for the drive . A very nice touch. Top hotel in Seattle .

Reviews.Title: “Great service; Great atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: dcrose
Reviews.Content: I am a fan of Fairmont properties and this one did not let us down. It is in a great location within walking distance to the market and all the various shopping, restaurants and theatres downtown. We upgraded to a suite which was larger than expected. The fitness area isn’t huge but has nice equipment and also has a nice indoor pool and jacuzzi. We ate dinner at The Georgian and highly recommend it for a formal dinner. Room service breakfast was prompt and good quality. The in room Keurig coffee machine was a nice touch. The hotel lobby and the Georgian restaurant both have old world charm with huge chandeliers and very high ceilings. Overall a very nice atmosphere right in the heart of the city. We arrived by car in the middle of a rain storm and rush hour traffic with many one way streets, so we just used valet parking ($39/day) as it wasn’t clear where the self park was. I have stayed at several hotels downtown and will be coming back to this one.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Old Lady”
Reviews.Author: PaddyCakeOregon
Reviews.Content: We love staying at the Fairmont Olympic. This year we stayed during the holidays. The decorations at the hotel were beautiful, beyond compare to other hotels. The Teddy Bear Suite was a great place for children and adults alike. The accommodations were excellent as usual. The bed wonderful, the room spotless, etc. We especially enjoy the little extra touches of bottled water and turn down service. You couldn't ask for anything to be better. Even though everything is great, what makes the Fairmont the best place to stay is the staff. Everyone is polite, helpful, and pleasant. When taking our pup outside in the middle of the night the bell man offered assistance and conversation. Wouldn't want to stay any place else in Seattle. The on-site seafood restaurant, Shuckers, offers fabulous food at fairly reasonable prices. Great oysters, salmon, scallops, etc. with friendly service from bartender and waiters. We went there four times during our stay!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “fairmont olympic”
Reviews.Author: ron g
Reviews.Content: Rooms spacious, comfortable but a bit old with a musty feel (although there is no musty smell) Food in hotel very expensive as is parking for hotel guests ($44)! Front desk and concierge services friendly, helpful and efficient!

Reviews.Title: “Excellence in Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Traveller3283
Reviews.Content: Christmas for singles or couples,... Awe inspiring Lobby and immediate recognition of your name throughout your stay, you truly feel like a VIP...wonderful pool and workout room...The staff treatment of you = VIP.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: liv2xplore
Reviews.Content: Fairmont is located within walking distance to great dining, shopping, theatre's & markets. The staff is very attentive with the guest satisfaction top priority. The Hotel is beautiful and even though they are constantly busy with guests, the housekeeping and grounds are kept immaculate. If you don't mind waiting 15-20 minutes for transportation they even offer a free shuttle service. For us the wait is worth it as we don't have to drive or pay for parking. Tip: go for the Staycation package. The price includes breakfast and parking (which can be a hassle if you are traveling during peak season).

Reviews.Title: “So nice!”
Reviews.Author: AMitch11
Reviews.Content: We love Fairmont hotels, so it was not a surprise that we enjoyed our stay. We usually stay at the W for Valentine's Day weekend, but we decided to mix it up. The service was excellent, and we had fun sitting in their bar off the lobby. The interior kind of made me feel like I was in the Titanic, definitely a different time period. The hotel is centrally located and it is a close walk to the 5th Ave Theater.

Reviews.Title: “make sure you specify a renovated room”
Reviews.Author: stefohnee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice - first time, we got a nice renovated room with marble bath at the end of a hallway (very quite). Second time I think I forgot to specify renovated room, or they interpreted "renovated" = "upgrade" because they upgraded us to a small suite. But it wasn't renovated, and boy did that room pale in comparison with the one we stayed in the first time we were here! I called down to the front desk and asked if any renovated rooms were available. They told me there was one on a lower floor if that was OK, and I said that was no problem. The manager actually ran the keys to our new room up to us in about 2 minutes! THAT is service! Kudos to you, Fairmont Olympic. The new room was also a suite, and the renovated rooms are SO MUCH NICER. Nicer bedding, cleaner-looking lines, nice paint tones, newer finishings like light switch face plates, nice new marble bathroom. I would probably give this place 3 or 4 stars if I had stayed in the original room they gave me during that stay. The hotel itself is in a good location - if you're heading out to I-5, you just go straight up the street a couple of blocks and you're there. Lots of restaurants, the SAM, and pike place market within blocks. There's a hotel car that can take you around the downtown area. The first time I stayed, I was having dinner at Canlis as part of the "find a key and get free dinner at Canlis" thing in October (I was graciously invited for helping! :) and I mentioned that I needed a taxi to one of the valets. Well, he told me to hang on and that he'd see if he could get the hotel car to take me. It was free, so they gave me a free ride to Canlis, which I must say is not exactly in the "downtown core", either. You guys are the best! The second time we stayed, it was a busier night so we had to wait about 20 minutes for the car to take us somewhere, but the driver was great, again (different guy). We were going to Kneehigh Stocking company, which is a speakeasy-type place and purposefully difficult to find. Well, our driver was so thoughtful - he made sure that he knew exactly where this place was before he would drop us off, probably so he'd know where to pick us up later that night, but it was really nice of him. The terrace lounge has some REALLY great drinks, if you like cocktails stop in and try a couple. All in all, I would definitely stay here again - great service, even if all the rooms aren't updated you could always try to ask for one that is.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a short Seattle stop”
Reviews.Author: marktodandtravel
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed this hotel. It was so nice that our trip to Seattle really turned into our trip to Seattle and the Fairmont Olympic. Just to start, my wife and I went to Seattle for a 3 day weekend to tour some wineries and eat fish. However after two excellent experiences with room service, we spent half our time sitting around in the comfortable room enjoying room service and the hotel pool. Checkin - Quick n' Easy Room - Took an upgrade to a suite, was totally worth it. Cleanliness - Totally clean and well kept. Location - Perfect - short walk to everything except the waterfront - and it was only a 10 minute walk to there. Overall, great trip, will be back.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and a good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JinLiAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: stayed for just 2 nights, consistently good. Gym with swimming pool open at 5 am which is fine coming from Europe. Improvement is the coffee machine in the room. Good breakfast; only point of attention is the speed of the service in case something is chosen from the menu.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious, filled with old world charm and up-to-date amenities”
Reviews.Author: Susan P
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Olympic is first class all around:. lovely rooms and baths, great health club and pool, elegant lobby, fine food in the Terrace Bar and the exquisite Georgian Room. Staff is efficient and friendly. Last stay was Thanksgiving weekend and as guests with many children and Black Friday shoppers filled the drive and the Terrace Bar I was amazed at the personal touches given by staff to all guests. This was the hotel at its most hectic and yet that feeling of being in a special place remained. The location is perfect, downtown with elegant shops and walkable to many Seattle restaurants and attractions. We were there for 6 days and it was hard to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Justine D
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Fairmont Olympic Hotel in Seattle twice now and I cannot say enough good things about it. Excellent service, good food with two stellar restaurants plus a coffee shop, The lobby is beautiful and there is a grand elegance about the place. Room service was prompt with excellent food. The concierge was gracious and helpful. In my opinion this hotel is a great value. I will be there again this summer

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel to Last”
Reviews.Author: Willfud10
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Fairmont Olympic at the end of our Scenic Tour of British Columbia and Alaska. It was not our intention to stop in Seattle but connecting flights back to Vancouver and Sydney could not be arranged so we begrudgingly paid for the extra night. Had we known how good the Olympic was we would have arranged to stay for another couple of nights. We had stayed in Fairmont Hotels all though our tour and the standard was extremely high, but the Olympic beat all the others hands down as far as we were concerned. Everything from the room, food and that amazing (football field) sized bed were just outstanding. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful and the location of the hotel made it very easy to navigate around town. Quick tip is try the Huckleberry pancakes for breakfast. If you are not a pancake person for breakfast, you soon will be.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for couples”
Reviews.Author: tyger_lily181
Reviews.Content: We had 4 girls in our group for a night on the town. The hotel has great amenities like pool, restaurants, work out room. We all shared a room with 2 twins and luckily they were bigger than the usual twin because 2 girls had to share. The hotel was only able to give us one rollaway due to fire restrictions. The pool/changerooms are amazing, feels like a spa. We found the hotel was more designed for couples than for groups because the rooms are smaller and more intimate but it is a beautiful hotel. We only ate here once and that was for dinner, the restaurants are all very pricey, as expected, but the food was amazing, we had a great time with our server Jay. The staff here are very quick and efficient, rooms are in great condition and I agree with another review that the hotel is a bit old fashioned but we didn't mind. The hotel is also very central to places like Pike Market, Seattle Underground, Pioneer Square although I suggest you cab it to some of these places as the hills in downtown Seattle are very steep. The Fairmont is very easy to find and very easy to get back onto the I-5. We thoroughly enjoyed our experience and I'm also a travel agent.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant!”
Reviews.Author: Petroski
Reviews.Content: Classy, elegant hotel! A bit old fashioned. May not be the place for you if you are looking for something newer and modern. Very friendly and attentive service.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing atmosphere for a Conference”
Reviews.Author: AbigailLynn
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were accommodating, the rooms are GORGEOUS and the food... too good for words! Make sure you have a chance to meet Chef Gavin, his food knowledge and passion is contagious! He even has his own beehives on the roof!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: CanadaXxxxxx
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont for thanksgiving weekend. The room was spacious, clean and in great condition. The lobby is very busy and can feel impersonal but we weren't looking for a personal relationship. All the staff we deal with were great and very helpful. The deal we got was fantastic through Expedia and I thought the stay was great value. It is also very nice to have access to a pool in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service is Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: DrOfWaves
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very nice, location excellent, but what makes this such an appealing choice is the first class customer service. I can overlook a small stain in the carpet or hints that a refurbish is underway. We have stayed in all the top Seattle hotels except the Four Seasons and this is our favorite. Close behind are the Pan Pacific and Hotel 1000. The Alexis rooms are nice but the staff stinks.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: BK1999
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a week while attending a conference in Seattle. The inside of the hotel is elegant and stylish with a beautiful lobby and very nice rooms. The location is also very nice and close to shopping and dining areas. A minor drawback is the pool and fitness center which is of average quality, the service is very nice though. This hotel is recommended for business travel in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great family mini vacation spot”
Reviews.Author: agiustino
Reviews.Content: Stayed with our 6 and 4 year old. They upgraded us to a suite with a king bed and pull out couch. We fit a roll away in the bedroom for our son so we were all very comfortable. Pool was fantastic for the kids and they even had a few pool toys. Hotel is classic fairmont with elegent sitting areas and dining room. We lucked out with the christmas trees being decorated for christmas. Definately recommend for families and even romantic spot with jazz music in the lounge in the evenings. Staff were professional and very helpful. We've stayed at atleast 5 other hotels downtown and will definately return to this one.

Reviews.Title: “Opulent, spacious with knowledgable concierges and excellent dining”
Reviews.Author: Mpollifax
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont is in a excellent location. Pikes market is walkable, as is the waterfront where you can (and should) pick up a ferry for a trip to one of the outer islands. Public transit is close by. Excellent shopping is also nearby for those of you so inclined. The room we had was spacious and very comfortable. The restaurant had excellent food. We asked the concierge for dining recommendations on several occasions and were directed to local restaurants with great food.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CafeBohemia
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Olympic is really the "grand dame" hotel of Seattle. Fantastic central location and beautiful historic building. Superb service. Pros: most of the rooms are very large and well sound-proofed, comfortable beds, superb fitness centre and pool, free wifi if you join Fairmonts President Club. Cons: expensive parking (common for Seattle), but you can park in neighboring lots for a bit less (a lot less if you leave your car on the street overnight).

Reviews.Title: “We loved our room and had a great stay at the Olympic.”
Reviews.Author: moe88
Reviews.Content: This hotel stay was just about perfect. Our room was so big. We had a king size bed and a roll away bed for our daughter and we still had plenty of extra room. The bathroom was huge and we had a spacious closet. We did go to the fine dining restaurant two nights out of the three nights we stayed at the hotel because it had such great meals. The prices were a bit high ...but I would recommend it if you had a special occasion or if fine dining was important to you. The Hotel is in a great location. You can get to every where you want in a matter of minutes by walking. The price for the Hotel was good after shopping around for prices. The front door people were helpful getting the car. Be sure to call down to let them know you are going to be getting your car...that will help with the wait time. Next time we go to Seattle we will try to stay back at the Fairmont Olympic...it is a fine hotel. Oh...when we arrived with our car they had our keys to our room right there and we did not have to go to the front desk...loved that too.

Reviews.Title: “Class act”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryMomDoc
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Classy. Central. Nice size. A little oasis. It felt like you were coming home everyday.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and good choice”
Reviews.Author: aliapis
Reviews.Content: The Hotel has a great location and is a lovely hotel. Albeit a bit weathered. The staff is great and it has that old feel of grandure. Most of the rooms are mini suites and are very comfortable and spacious. There is an excellent coffee shop attached to the hotel that makes it easy to spring out of bed and make your way down for a coffee and excellent variety of pastries. You can request a coffee maker for your room as well which I find convienient. There is often great value in the cocktails at happy hour in the hotel and it is a great lounge. It is very conviently located and great access to everything. The Valet attendents are excellent and have great knowledge of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with Service to Match”
Reviews.Author: sunkissedrain
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Fairmont was for a business conference. I usually don't stay in places this nice on my own dime, so I was super excited at the chance to check it out! The room I received was really nice, although it was the one closest to the elevator bank, noise was not really a problem, unless someone was REALLY loud. Even better, the bed was segregated from the rest of the room by a panel that closed, so it could block sound even further - and all of this was just the "standard" room - nothing fancy. The bathroom was beautiful, all white marble and chrome. Two cons: the phone on the desk was broken, and the toilet flooded (but what can you expect, this place is like 100 years old, so I'm sure the toilets here aren't too powerful). Each time I called the front desk/concierge for help, they were really polite and friendly, and fixed anything I needed right away. The food in this place is to DIE for!!! I am used to the usual dry fish and chicken in hotels - not so here! The chef really seems to pride himself on not only serving delicious food, but doing it in an innovative manner, which is pleasing to the eye and palate. I couldn't have been more impressed. Additionally, the servers were all very nice, and anything you needed, they were there to help. Overall, the experience was good - wish that I hadn't needed to call the front desk so much, but at least it was handled quickly and efficiently. Plus, I'd go back for the food alone anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, better location”
Reviews.Author: Seajax
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairmont for 2 nights. This location is fantastic! It is walking distance to everything: The Convention Center, Pike's Place, shopping, and even the Space Needle if you're up for a walk. We made it to the Space Needle going down 4th street which is about 1.3 miles away (Lucky that there wasn't any rain!). The hotel is very old, and beautiful. The room was good sized, with a complimentary paper each morning, robes and slippers. We had a corner room with a peek of the space needle and the rooftops nearby. We chose to self-park around the corner at the structure. However, just a word of warning if you need an accessible entrance. Unfortunately, the only way to get from the self-park structure to the street is down some stairs or through an attached convenience store when stairs cannot be used (Which a security guard had to come meet us after calling on the call box and show us the way). The store is open I believe from 7am-9pm - so this means, if you plan to self -park outside of these hours and cannot use stairs, you are stuck. When we pulled up to the Valet parking at the Fairmont, we explained we were going to self-park so the valets wouldn't have to mess with the hand controls on the car. It would have been nice if they had let us know there were restrictions on the accessibility of the parking garage. I understand this doesn't apply to most people...but again, would have been nice to know. If we weren't driving over to Spokane after, we wouldn't have needed a car. It sat in the garage from arrival until check-out. I would recommend not renting a car if you are staying at the Fairmont and don't need to drive out of town. The bathroom in our room was nice and big, and was probably one of the coldest I have ever stayed in due to the single pane window. Ahh...the charm of old buildings! :) Unfortunately, we didn't have time to check out "Purple" a wine bar across the street, but it will definitely be on our list next time! I recommend the Fairmont for the elegance of the building and fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: YTOAY
Reviews.Content: Classy hotel and the lobby is nice, was upgraded to a suite. Two 32in LED TV one in living room and one inside bed room. Rooms are clean, spent three nights and all morning calls are call by person not digital wake up calls. The American breakfast is quite big, nice food. Within walking distance to Pike market.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in downtown”
Reviews.Author: whatupdude
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to enjoy a long weekend at the Fairmont Olympic. If you want a great location and a classy hotel, this is the place. The service is top notch, the rooms are clean, and the overall experience is super.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: damoritz
Reviews.Content: What an amazing hotel! Given the warmest welcome you could expect and being offered an upgrade to a larger suite made for the start of a great stay. The view from the room was fantastic, and the hotel's spa and gym was seocnd to non. We indulged in cocktails in the hotel lobby bar one evening and had a great time! Will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Rillabub
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on this hotel I did have doubts, however, they were all unfounded. It is in a great location we could walk to everything, the staff were fantastic they could not do enough for us and our room was beautiful. It was my birthday and our wedding anniversary and they gave us a room upgrade, strawberries and a card, they made our stay wonderful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: TaylorRose
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights in mid September pre-Alaska cruise. It is an older hotel but was absolutely beautiful! The concierge desk was extremely helpful and was probably one of the reasons we had a great time in Seattle - they let us know where the best restaurants were and which attractions were worth seeing. Our room, though some might consider it small by some standards, we found it to be quiet, comfortable chair for reading, a wonderful bed - not too soft and to too firm, and a very nice redecorated bathroom. The location was great as everything we wanted to see was in walking distance, although be warned Seattle is very hilly! It's a 5 star hotel and it is well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Room(s)”
Reviews.Author: MozieOne
Reviews.Content: We took relatives visiting from Switzerland and were counting on a great stay at the Fairmont. I used a corporate rate which may have been the reason for very mediocre rooms. They both had very narrow twin beds and a small bathroom. Overall the hotel was nice with great atmosphere, lobby and location --- but watch which rooms they give you!. The service was good, except for check-in which got delayed over an hour after they told us it would be ready. Next time we'll look for another luxury class hotel in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “awesome staff!”
Reviews.Author: arae780
Reviews.Content: Fairmont's staff always seem to go above and beyond. We really notice this time/ We missed our first flight and they gladly helped us out with our reservation.
