Accommodated to our needs as well as left us chocolate covered strawberries in our room for our anniversary! Great location as well! easy from airport.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious!”
Reviews.Author: Ross H
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel while I was attending the PAX Prime convention. I knew that it was going to be expensive, but I hat little choice since I had made my bookings late. Nevertheless, I found this hotel to be impressive. My room was large, luxurious and well furnished. Unfortunately, I was on a budget so, I wasn't able to enjoy the many services offered by the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Classic, charming and well-run”
Reviews.Author: dldmia
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful, with a great location and elegant ambiance. The staff makes it run well. Walking distance to many attractions and restaurants, makes it convenient. This place is one to consider for a comfortable stay in Seattle. For a healthy breakfast, try the heart healthy egg white veggie omlet breakfast in the cafe off the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and sumptuous hotel”
Reviews.Author: pinkchouchong
Reviews.Content: Since it was our first time in Seattle, we wanted to stay at some place special and this was it! It is centrally located, within walking distance to all major tourist spots, such as the Market, the shops, art museum, even the harbor. The hotel itself is beautiful and classical, very sumptuous full of old charm. The room is spacious, beds very comfortable. Beautiful bathroom. Staff were very friendly Only complain is that the internet is not free. Don't understand why the expensive hotels all charge the internet service while many value for money hotels offer it free. Would recommand this hotel to people who want to splurge.

Reviews.Title: “Like the old time dream hotels of past...”
Reviews.Author: RBNY65
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an incredible pleasant surprise. The location can't be beat, and the staff were super friendly and incredibly attentive. While I only spent one night, the rate was reasonable for a 5 star property. The chauffered limo that was offered to take us to and from a distant restaurant added that special touch to the trip. The only let down was that internet service was not included in the price. Given that one can go to any Starbucks for free internet, especially in this town, that was a bit surprising.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Landmark Property-Best Location!”
Reviews.Author: derby3680
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights 9/30-10/6/11 and we entirely satisfied with our stay at the Fairmont Olympic in downtown Seattle! Comfy beds, bathrobes (if you want to use them), A+ service from every single employee we encountered! We utilized the concierge and she got us a very affordable rental car from the Hilton Kiosk (two blocks away)...just needed the car for a quick trip to the Premium Outlets and The Casino (about 25miles all expressway). I got to experience their "Georgian Tea" which was a delicious, one-of-a-kind experience. Housekeeping was done at the perfect time EVERY day...we never even saw them. The hotel location is conveniently close to everything downtown...we walked everywhere!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Splurge - Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: larawankenobi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont Olympic twice during September and October 2011. We spent more then we usually budget for a hotel, but we had visited the lobby before and knew it would be a special stay in a historic hotel. The Fairmont completely lived up to our expectations. The staff at the lobby desks, the valets and bellboys were all extrememly helpful and friendly. The rooms were spotless and luxurious. The swimming and gym facilities were expecially well maintained and comfortable. The location was excellent for walking to downtown Seattle tourist sites. The farthest north you would want to walk from this location is the Space Needle, the farthest south would be Safeco Field and Century Link Stadium. We spent 120 - 150 GBP per night through hotels.com. In some cases we were able to secure a deal where if you purchased two nights, the third night was free. If we could have changed anything, we would have liked a breakfast and WiFi to be included in the price of the rooms. Overall, we would definitely go back and recommend this hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Lost our car!”
Reviews.Author: c5coupe
Reviews.Content: August 2010 we stayed at the Fairmont. Sorry if this is posted a little late. The hotel subcontracts with another business for valet parking. After waiting for a hour they finally located our car. The parking fee was high ($50+) for poor service. Instead of taking responsibility the staff blamed the subcontractor. I may stay there again but only after all the other hotels are full.

Reviews.Title: “This place is dreamy.....”
Reviews.Author: frequenttraveler4511
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Fairmont Olympic in Seattle WA. My experience at this hotel was extraordinary. Where this place really excels in in the service provided to guests. I booked a Suite which consisted of a bedroom area and a living area. Unlike other guests who have reported that their rooms had stained carpet or sub-par furnishings, my experience was much different. Although this is an older hotel, my room was in great shape! The linens, amenities, and bath products are top-notch and luxurious. If you go to this hotel, you can expect that your every whim will be catered to. I forgot my toothpaste and within two minutes, a small sample was delivered to my room. Room service is served in an elegant fashion and my sandwich was delicious. The public spaces in this hotel are gorgeous and virtual eye-candy. I had breakfast in the Georgian restaurant which was very nice. Expect to pay dearly for almost everything at this hotel but the excellent service and the setting more than pays for itself. They even have a courtesy car to take you to locations within a one mile radius of the hotel. I have traveled extensively and found this was one of my favorite hotel experiences.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with Wonderful Amenities”
Reviews.Author: cindysview
Reviews.Content: Grand lobby with beautiful flowers and historic appeal. Fitness club with pool and jacuzzi under a glass atrium. Marble bathroom with separate vanity was very nice. Nice linens and huge towels. Free hairdryer provided. Corner room gave us street views in two directions. We had "Fairmont Twins" beds. Beds gave both of us backaches (no pillow top, hard with no middle back support). Mattresses looked like they were the same as those produced in the 1950s. Staff needs additional training about what services are available at the hotel: Asked if free coffee offered early in the lobby, we were offered complimentary coffee pot from food services (with 2 servings of coffee) but not told there is free coffee & hot tea in the fitness center all day every day. Room only has a minibar; no microwave, no coffee pot setup or replenishment service. A/C not up to the 80-85 degree weather: we had to sleep without covers to keep comfortable (two women). No ceiling fan. Great for a one day stay but not for any length of time because of the beds. We eventually solved all the other issues on our own (except for the lack of a microwave).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Gamelanlover
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mother before an Alaksa cruise in September 2010. Upon entering the hotel, we loved the ornate lobby. Our room was absolutely beautiful and very functional. We had a very nice lunch at a seafood restaurant that is part of the hotel, and finally, upon the morning of departure, I used the swimming pool. Urban hotels often have poorly placed pool facilities but this one was nice- almost in a sunroom, the pool was not huge but amply sized, and the hot tub was a nice touch. I'd definitely stay here again if I was coming through Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “What a Grand Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Questmeister
Reviews.Content: This is life as it should be. As soon as we arrived in the ornate lobby we knew this was something special. We were having a reunion of sorts with friends from Seattle and Vancouver and selected the Olympic for its elegance and genteel atmosphere. We were not disappointed. Everything was perfect: our lunch in the Georgian restaurant, the cocktails in the lobby bar, the large, comfortable room with a view of downtown Seattle, and most of all the friendly and courteous service (quite uncommon in large chain hotels). How nice to find east coast elegance in a informal west coast city!

Reviews.Title: “VERY NOISY ROOM!”
Reviews.Author: 1Jewel
Reviews.Content: Well it would be wrong of me to rate the Fairmont Olympic Hotel in Seattle as "poor" because it is really beautiful and the people are all wonderful. I was just so dissapointed with the noise level in my room. I did have a lower level room and perhaps it would have made a difference if I were higher up. My room was in constant annoyance of police and fire engines as well as plain old traffic. I really didn't realize the hotel was smack dab in the middle of downtown and all that goes along with that. On the plus side, I was exhausted when I arrived and could not bring myself to even go down to the restaurant to eat dinner...so I ordered room service. Pretty pricey but honestly the best fish and chips I think I have ever had...and I live in Hawaii so that says a lot! Also when I checked out the next morning, the darling valet had a bag with homemade chocolate chip cookies and milk in my car waiting for me to take for my road trip. He brought me bottled water too and I just thought that was a lovely gesture. I appreciate beauty and staying in nice places but I don't think I would stay at the Fairmont Olympic Hotel in Seattle again. It's just a little too "stuffy". I much prefer the Edgewater Hotel located right on the water in Seattle. Close in price with the Fairmont but just more inviting in my opinion! Mahalo!

Reviews.Title: “Seattle's most refined hotel”
Reviews.Author: hotel_goddess0
Reviews.Content: from the moment we arrived, we knew we were in the right place! The service is impeccable and the ambience is inviting. This hotel is full of history and iconic charge in one of the PNW's best cities. We had dinner in The Georgian and it was one of the best meals we've ever had. I cannot wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, a little worn and dated”
Reviews.Author: jld1975
Reviews.Content: We stayed here September 1-4 with 2 adults and 2 small children in an executive suite for a convention at the nearby convention center. This hotel as everyone has said is very nice. The public areas are beautiful, the staff very helpful, the location within walking distance to the convention center, waterfront, and Pike Place market very good. The linens were very comfortable. The 360 virtual tour on the website is pretty accurate of what the room we were in looked like, with the exception that they have replaced the tube TVs with flat screens. They allowed us to move things in the minibar to accomodate the kids medicine and milk, which was nice. The room was worn, though. The carpet was either very dirty or (I hope) discolored and there were places where the carpet had obviously been patched. The wallpaper was peeling in spots. The loveseat was in pretty good condition, but both the desk chair and the lounge chair were fraying and quite worn. One of the blinds did not work properly. As others have mentioned, the divider between the two rooms is just a sheer curtain, and ours was pulled off the door in a couple of places. It was okay with the kids, but we did have to turn off all the lights, move the TV and sit in the dark very quietly after 8pm when they went to bed which wasn't ideal, but was fine. So, if you want a classic hotel with great services, large rooms, and a great location, this is a great place to stay as long as you are prepared for it being a little worn inside the rooms, and for the issue of the room divider if you are getting one of the suites.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property”
Reviews.Author: LouiseTheTraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went here for our honeymoon. The room was wonderful and spacious. The service was great and we had a fantastic time. They even have a house car ( a beautiful new Jaguar) that will drive you around at no fee, its first come first serve so on the weekends its hard to catch it but if you stay during the week it was very easy to use. You do hear quite a bit of noise in the morning hours from the traffic but we took it as part of the charm of it being an older hotel. The pool was also very nice, it did get crowded on Saturday but it was empty on the Friday. We wanted to come back for another stay this coming weekend but they were completly sold out, we were bummed but we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Sets a New Standard in Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Mamanem2
Reviews.Content: On a recent Alaska cruise we spent a night in Seattle. The agency arranged for the Fairmont hotel to be the host hotel for this trip and we were delighted that they did. Our room was a clean, comfortable deluxe king with a large dressing room and his and her closets. This hotel is truly the best. The staff is friendly and helpful and the service was excellent. This is the nicest hotel that we have ever visited.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!!! Great Iconic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GJM17
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a classic beautiful property in the heart of all the upscale resturants and stores. The lobby has beautiful wood work and the main dinning room is just incredible. I've stayed at the Plaza in NYC and this dinning room is truly amazing. The breakfast was incredible , they had home made fruit juices made of raspberry and apple ,incredible. If you use your AMex Platinum card your eligible for the fine hotel and resort perks. That include breakfast for two everyday. We loved it !!! We almost stayed at the W which was next door its very nice but very modern. not the classy feel.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable experience!!”
Reviews.Author: sunchica27
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Olympic for the first time, and were not surprised by the grandeur of the hotel. It was simply beautiful, our room was breathtaking! The staff was very pleasant and warm. As our car was pulled around by valet, there was a snack bag of milk and cookies on the passage seat, nice touch. We were able to pick up a latte and croissant in the hotel bakery. The chocolate was gourmet, and simply the best mocha I have had in a long time, and in Seattle nonetheless :) We hope to return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, beautiful room”
Reviews.Author: PrinceCharmingtravel
Reviews.Content: I have no complaints about this hotel... it was beautiful, the rooms were gorgeous and so spacious. The valet crew was amazing!! Super friendly, extra helpful with directions even though it was technically not their 'job'. Every staff member was over and beyond courteous, polite, friendly and always smiling. We 'found' this hotel online and decided to give it a try, and our expectations were met far and above. The pool and exercise room was very very clean. Will be going back to Seattle next year and this will be the hotel of choice from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Top Rate Customer Service Hotel”
Reviews.Author: claudia
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at this hotel. The staff couldn't have tried any hard to please us. At one banquet, the waiter actually sent someone for non-alcoholic beer for my husband - letting us know he was doing that - and updating us. This was during a large business banquet when the staff was pretty busy. The fact they actually cared about his request was amazing. The room (suite) was beautiful. Maid service timely and efficient. Food for the banquet was the best we had all weekend. Even after another event with a very-famous chef's catering. Would love to go back and explore more of Seattle. We'll stay at this hotel when we do.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but loud”
Reviews.Author: cybeerkeg
Reviews.Content: Nice comfortable hotel, but our room was very loud with street noise. Thankfully the bed/linens were very comfy so it let us sleep through most of it. A couple of times our requests were forgotten/ignored by housekeeping staff. The location in Seattle was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great service, great location”
Reviews.Author: SATravelers
Reviews.Content: Everyone at this hotel did an absolutely outstanding job. Pulled up in a cab and greeted immediately by Danny with valet. Not only did he quickly take care of our bags but he also gave a quick tour of the large lobby and advice on local events going on in the city during our stay. Room was large and clean, very comfortable bed. Room service was quick and polite. Hotel is in a great location, easy walk to the market and restaurants. Fitness was adequate, did not use indoor pool but it looked nice. The staff in the fitness center also did a great job making sure we had plenty water, clean towels etc. Check out was fast and easy. Only one complaint, it would have been nice if the desk in the room had more outlets on top so you don't have to crawl under it to plug in your devices and chargers. Ended up using outlet in bathroom for cell charger. Other than that, there's really nothing else to criticize. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great city hotel”
Reviews.Author: DonnieP
Reviews.Content: Spectacular service from arrival to departure. Valet greets you with towel and water bottle after a morning jog. Great dining at shuckers. Easy location to all major Seattle sights. We even walked to game at Safeco Field

Reviews.Title: “They take great care of you”
Reviews.Author: Chianti_girl24
Reviews.Content: I began staying at the Fairmont downtown after a co-worker suggested it. Their President's Club benefits are great and they honor you as a return customer. The beds are wonderful, rooms clean and spacious. Great home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at The Olympic”
Reviews.Author: bouldercolorado45
Reviews.Content: Had an Exec Suite, which was spacious and very comfortable. The one drawback was the street noise due to the old windows. We were on the 3 rd floor, and it was really loud at times ( Ambulances, police sirens, etc...). Next time, we are requesting the highest floor they have.... Oyster restaurant, Shuckers, was great as was the breakfast in the main dining room. Friendly service throughout the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely lovely”
Reviews.Author: RJones404
Reviews.Content: I loved everything about this experience. Didn't eat at the restaurants, so can't comment on that, but used the gym and pool, which were great. Staff were very friendly and accommodating and the room was large with a very comfortable bed. Location was good, but it is a steep climb from the waterfront.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Katerina_CA
Reviews.Content: I really wish I could stay longer than one day at this beautiful property. Fairmont Seattle was definitely one of the better places I came across in my travels (which by the way is not true of all Fairmont properties). It was perfection from the moment we pulled into the driveway and until the moment we checked out. The location is great, smack in the middle of downtown, the rooms are spacious and beautifully furnished with super comoftable beds. Bathrooms are huge and nicely decorated. Service is great. Great fitness center with a good size pool. Delicious breakfast brought right on time. In other words, this hotel has everything that one can possibly need.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: debs0712
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Fairmont Olympic on August 25th. Our check-in was very quick and we were given the keys to our room as they took our luggage from our rental car. Our room was on the 11th floor and was very clean and in good condition. The only negatives are that there was no coffee maker in the room and the air conditioning didn't work that well. We needed to turn the temperature down to cold to get the room cool. The employees at the hotel are extremely friendly and helpful. Breakfast in the restaurant is expensive but very good. We also went downstairs to the Belle Epicurean coffee shop on the lower level. Excellent croissants and coffee. Don't miss it!

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD HOTEL--GREAT STAFF”
Reviews.Author: SANTravelers
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel. It's an older "grand dame" type of hotel (like Palmer House in Chicago) which used to be the best hotel in Seattle. Great "bones" (architecture) and elegance. Rooms (we upgraded to a suite for only $30 more) are nice if the drapes and furnishings a bit dated, very comfortable. A few fewer electrical sockets than needed today as is common in older hotels. Quiet--walls are very thick. Best thing about the hotel is the staff--they are truly wonderful, gracious, friendly, and accommodating, from the check in to room service to the wait staff in the very lovely breakfast room. The breakfasts as in all hotels is expensive but you get the value for the money as the food and the choices are excellent. One failing: they charge $15.35 for basic internet (outrageous to charge we think in any hotel today). But unlike many hotels easy to get around. Just sign up for their "President's Club" any time during your stay (which is free), and they remove the internet charges. Not the greatest internet as it is sometimes weak and unreliable (more reason not to pay for it) but when I wrote a message to customer service complaining about it, the IT manager called me and increased the bandwidth. It worked much better after that but still not perfect (think the thick walls may impede; trade-offs). Still my wife and I really enjoyed our stay. Location is also great. Walking distance to whole downtown.

Reviews.Title: “SHOULD BE A 6 STAR HOTEL - OUTSTANDING PROPERTY”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELWITHFAF
Reviews.Content: Outstanding five diamond hotel ( the only one in Seattle), very classy, but not snobish, finely furnished, attentive personnel, and centerally located, near most atttractions and shopping. helpfull conceige services. Big king size rooms and bath, luxurious linens and bedding. also attentive to families.old world charm fit for royalty. To get the real feel of the city, have the conceige book an escorted air conditioned bus tour of the city and its landmarks. This will show how centerally located the Fairmont Hotel is to shopping and attractions.

Reviews.Title: “The Best. Staff and service are outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: Shandong
Reviews.Content: Our family of 12 stayed here prior to boarding a cruise ship the next day. Every room was ready with the bedding we'd requested in each room with children. The children were given "cookie passes" for complimentary cookies and milk from room service at bed time. The following morning at breakfast we had a sumptuous private room off the main dining room. The breakfast buffet was fresh and had everything imaginable. You could also order from the menu and children's menus were available. We'd not planned to stay overnight at the end of our cruise but Hurricane Irene altered our plans and we were all back at the Fairmont for a few more days. The staff was just extremely accommodating. The rooms are very large and very well appointed, beds are heavenly. If you join their President's club (no charge) you are eligible for free wireless. There is a brandnew long Jaguar and driver available for guests to use for short hops (2-3 miles) from the hotel gratis although I think you're supposed to trip the driver. We've travelled alot and this was the ultimate in luxury and service; yes, the bathroom faucets were a little outdated, but they worked fine and gushed hot & cold water. The hotel is immaculate.

Reviews.Title: “Old World”
Reviews.Author: funsandiego
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel reminiscent of another era. Service was good for the most part - we were leaving on a cruise the following day and we asked to borrow a stapler so we could attach our luggage tags to our luggage and were required to exchange our drivers license in exchange for the stapler. Not good PR for a top hotel! We were told they had lost too many staplers! Our suite was very nice with a partial waterfront view, comfortable king bed and nice sitting area with french doors separating the bedroom and sitting area. Nice bathrooms with quality anemities Food was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Em C
Reviews.Content: This was definitely one of the best hotel experiences I've ever had. The service was incredible and the food was excellent. We had never stayed at a fairmont hotel before but suffice to say we're definitely sold!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay...”
Reviews.Author: FudgiefromCurrie
Reviews.Content: Well, I stayed here with my husband for three nights before heading out to the San Juan Islands, and in spite of my love of boutique hotels I enjoyed the Fairmont. The basic room was large, clean and had everything we needed. In addition, Shuckers, the restaurant served lovely food, if a little pricey. There is a sort of faded splendour about the place but despite my initial hesitation the hotel really delivered. The small gym was fantastic, and the friendly staff great. I have to add that the bed was probably the most comfortable bed I have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, grand hotel in excellent location, but privacy an issue in suite.”
Reviews.Author: AquaPar
Reviews.Content: The facility and amenities are lovely, and the service was topnotch. The location is terrific, and you can walk to many sights and excellent restaurants, BUT we were surprised and dismayed to discover that the doors between the bedroom and the living room were not solid. In the photos, they look like French doors with curtains, when they actually are just frames with sheer fabric in the center. This means that there is no sound barrier and the light coming through the sheer fabric leaves no privacy even for dressing. Although it would be fine for a couple, we had thought the suite would suffice for us and our college-age daughter, but it really did not work well. I would caution others who might make the same mistake. We would have been better off in two rooms--either there or some place less expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay...super housekeeping staff”
Reviews.Author: TUCK1995
Reviews.Content: Had a very nice stay in adjoining rooms, which worked out perfectly for our family of four. Rooms were well appointed and very comfortable. Only complaint is that the room lacked conveniently located power outlets. Perhaps the most impressive part of the stay is that the housekeeping staff found and promptly returned my wedding band, which I accidentally left behind. Hugely grateful to Cathy who kindly helped out.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont Did It Again!”
Reviews.Author: Msbell69
Reviews.Content: This Fairmont was over the top in luxury, style, service and anything else you want to toss in there. This is a hotel that if you just did not remove the price tag off your clothing you will feel outdated. I wanted to run down to the lobby for a quick second however I hesitated to make sure what I had on looked as what the hotel expected. If you are looking for a hotel to impress your parter or spouse this is a great place to do so. I could write a novel here but I would be repeating myself. If you expect and demand the best than this Fairmont will not let you down. You may walk in feeling like $10's but you will walk out feeling like a $1M's

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel -- Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: pirk1146
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently had a very pleasant stay in an Executive Suite at the Fairmont Olympic. I am a light sleeper and was concerned about the noise in the first room they showed us. The manager actually came up to make sure we got a room that was to our satisfaction. That was just the beginning of the exceptionally attentive service we received. I was attending meetings at another hotel and the doorman made certain the hotel car (a gorgeous Jaguar!) was available to take me to the meeting each morning. Any request we had was taken care of promptly. We ate at both The Georgian and Shuckers --rare to have two terrific restaurants in one hotel. The room itself was small for a suite. But the bedroom was separated from the sitting area by french doors, which was convenient. There was some variation in the size and upkeep between the three different rooms we saw. The one we ended up in was nicely appointed, well maintained, and had a comfortable bed. The price we got from the hotel was reasonable for a suite in a first class hotel. We travel a lot and I'd have to say the service was among the most outstanding we've ever experienced. We'd gladly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonder old school hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hewesema
Reviews.Content: Classic great hotel. Rooms are larger than most old hotels and it is wonderfully maintained. For the business traveler, the rooms are not as well designed as a more modern hotel but it is a classy place.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: JJG24
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently in August and absolutely loved it! The best part is the gym, which feels really new and has a HUGE hot tub. The hotel itself is very old school decadence. The concierge was super helpful with planning shopping trips, helping us figure out how to get to Victoria and seemed incredibly informed about the area. They were always there and always super pleasant to talk to. The rooms were clean and the bed was comfortable. We really enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we booked”
Reviews.Author: Salty-seadogs
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel shame they didn't have the rooms we booked. I had requested 1 Twin bedded and 1 Double room. They offered us 2 doubles which was not acceptable as my 23 year old son and 19 year old daughter would never share a bed! We complained and were told they were fully booked, no offer of a free upgrade. They put in a roll up bed in the double room. We asked for another room and were given a bigger room with a bedroom and a sofabed, that was more uncomfortable than the sofabed. It spoiled a very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, infuriating internet”
Reviews.Author: ajlbb
Reviews.Content: This is a really lovely "old money" hotel. The service was really exceptional, even the bellmen holding the doors were extremely polite without being overzealous. My room was LARGE, especially for an old hotel, although I was on the end of a block so I'm not sure if all them are so big. Had I brought my family, there would have been space for a crib AND a rollaway bed, plus all the luggage, etc. Very clean, too. Another nice surprise was the room service. I tend to order it when on business since I work in my room a lot (and don't enjoy sitting at the bar with other lonely solo travelers). One evening I had already eaten while walking around the city so just wanted something light when I got back, so I ordered an appetizer salad and slice of cake. The salad turned out to be meal size, and included rolls with a goat cheese spread(!) The cake was so large I saved half of it for the next night. It isn't often room service surprises you with more than you can eat. It was delicious too. Oh and speaking of walking around, the location is really nice. Four blocks from the waterfront, five or six blocks from the monorail. Easily walkable to most of the sights. So why not five stars, you ask? Well, the wi-fi made my work almost impossible. They offer two options- standard access for $15/day, which already seems pricey to me, or "premium" for $25/day. Standard was included in my company rate, so I connected the first night and found myself having to manually disconnect and reconnect about every 10-15 mins or so. The next night I went for premium, which was marginally faster but crashed with the same frequency. The third night I used my dicey air card, which was a vast improvement. Save yourself some money and avoid it altogether if you are vacationing and/or don't need to send & receive docs.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: valentinew
Reviews.Content: My son and I spent two wonderful days at the Fairmont Olympic Hotel in Seattle. We arrived at 1:00pm and they offered an early check-in and a room upgrade. Room was large, nicely furnished and light. We went shopping and then had a great lunch outside at Schucker’s. It was Sea Fair weekend and beautiful weather. We enjoyed our swim in their Spa. Slept soundly, the beds and linens were perfect. Breakfast in the Georgian Room was excellent except for the $24.00 orange juice (juice was freshly squeezed). We went swimming each morning. They have complimentary coffee/tea and fruit at the Spa. Spent one afternoon at Volunteer Park. Enjoyed the view from the water tower, the Blue Angels were flying right overhead. The Conservatory was fabulous, as always. Gas Works Park was the highlight of the afternoon. Highly recommend the Olympic. It was our second visit and this was better than the first, which I didn’t think was possible

Reviews.Title: “Love the hotel, but the bar service is disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Plumesie
Reviews.Content: We have visited this hotel many times over the years, even lived in Seattle in the 80-90's and used to come for dinners and afternoon tea there. So when we visit the PNW, we always try to stay there, to enjoy the wonderful architecture and generally good service. This time we were less than impressed with the lobby bar service. Two nights in a row, and with different waitresses, we either didn't get what we ordered, were met with confusion or did not get anything until we reminded the staff. The staff seemed inexperienced for this type of a place and with these prices. The hotel did not appear to be very busy either, so it's hard to figure out the reason for the poor service. I am sorry to see this as it negatively impacted our overall impression of the hotel property. We found a completely different service level in the Fairmont Vancouver Hotel the following day, so good service can still be had! I hope it will return to the Seattle property for our next visit to the PNW.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, historic location- a bit impersonal”
Reviews.Author: SueinNZ
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights here. The location is superb- particularly handy for the Fifth Avenue theatre and also for the Art Gallery, library and the Transport tunnel at Union/ Third (with the link to the airport). The lobby and restaurant are very beautiful indeed and there is a luxurious air to the place. I had a deluxe room on the corner, which I liked very much- it was spacious, with a huge bed and a comfortable desk/ chair. Breakfast in the morning was very reasonably priced (20 dollars for a very good buffet). My only reservation was the lack of personal contact during the stay- eg no greeting ever from any of the door staff, who were too busy sorting out cars/ taxis or chatting to each other to ever make eye contact with someone going in or out of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “a great experience”
Reviews.Author: mcdonald121
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel very much. went for a business trip w/my husband and he attended a conference there. the service was very good and the setting was beautiful but it was very expensive. I'd consider returning if i was going to splurge, other wise there were many more reasonably priced hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, classic style -- but desperately in need of renovations"”
Reviews.Author: ACalGal
Reviews.Content: As a frequent Fairmont fan, I have to confess to being disappointed in the Fairmont Olympic. Wow does this hotel need upgrades. It is so outdated! Their only option for rooms with two beds are rooms with two SINGLE beds. Single beds? This isn't Europe, gang. It's Seattle in 2011, with lots of other excellent hotel choices. And, here at the Fairmont Olympic, the in-room wallpaper, carpet and furniture all is looking worn and -- for a Fairmont property -- downright tatty. However, the location is superb, the concierge staff is pretty good and the valet/bellmen are absolutely the best in town.

Reviews.Title: “A top hotel in a top location”
Reviews.Author: Robanddianne
Reviews.Content: Our cruise ship stopped in Seattle so we stayed for four days so we could take in what Seattle had to offer a fabulous city, we loved the markets, the needle, the Boeing Factory, the Aquarium was awesome and the Olympic has the best Concierge in the world. An excellent stay, not sure of the cost per night as we were on a voucher but it was worth the money. So central to all we wanted to do. Top marks in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service for outdated hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1trillium
Reviews.Content: Service is very important to me and this hotel delivers. Everyone was very friendly and helpful and did not act like you were an inconvenience when you needed assistance. A good nights sleep is also important to me and unfortunately I did not get one here. You could hear the traffic outside as if your window was left open and there were sirens throughout the night, every night we were there. If you are a heavy sleeper I would definitely recommend this place as the service is great as well as the location. If your not then you need to look elsewhere. The furnishings are also outdated which again, I would overlook because of the great service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: lucey12
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont exceeded our expectations for an older city chain hotel. Our room was spacious and well situated, in a quiet location. The most outstanding feature of the hotel is the commitment to service, from the breakfast staff, valet, to the concierge. We received especially wonderful care from Emily, a concierge. She always remembered our name and concerns and had wonderful solutions to our inquiries from dinner reservations to shipping and delivery services. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Pdg_1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for a vacation. It was very good. The staff members were very helpful and courteous. The location was excellent – within walking distance from the Market, theater area and other tourist sites. The décor of our room was dated, although very spacious. The hotel had valet parking only, $39/day, but self-parking was available at $29 a few blocks away. Wireless internet was free if you are a President Club member (free to enrol and you can do it when you check in); the signal was good. We were thankful for the good coffee and decadent pastry at Belle Epicurean around the corner (direct access from the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Great Room but Had to wait forever for it!”
Reviews.Author: JuniperTree44
Reviews.Content: The hotel and room were great. The room definitely was waaaay more than we expected and exceeded all expectations. Service on the other hand, a little disappointing. We had asked for early check-in at 11:00 am. We arrived at 1pm and our room still wasn't ready. They said there was issue that engineering was looking into. We had to wait about 45 minutes until it was sorted out. No apology was offered. This was the only turn off since the hotel location was good and the room was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Awful!”
Reviews.Author: DTL111
Reviews.Content: Q. What do you get when you take a Four Seasons Resort Hotel and do absolutely nothing to it for 20 years? A. The Fairmont Olympic Hotel in Seattle. Back in its day, this hotel was quite a treat. Since then, it has deteriorated dramatically. Everything from the unclean carpet, out-of-date rooms, grimy pool area, and general dirty feeling made my stay at this hotel simply awful. I will say, however, the food was quite good (expensive, but good).

Reviews.Title: “The Grand Dame of Seattle”
Reviews.Author: BENZAMG
Reviews.Content: The Olympic is still one of the best hotels in Seattle.The location is perfect,the staff friendly and welcoming and the public areas exude class.For a special evening out make sure to book their car service which features a brand new Jaguar XJ.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: tchoukou
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay, the hotel is lovely, the service is excellent, good location, downtown and not far from the waterfront. I just regret they do not propose kids activities, or somebody who can take care or the kids for like 1h.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey, but good”
Reviews.Author: FamilyMan70
Reviews.Content: Stayed three days. Room was dated. Bed was very comfortable. Service was excellent. William is a great concierge. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great historic hotel in a good location!”
Reviews.Author: bela492005
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight on a Friday with my husband and baby and my brother, sister-in-law and their young son. We got adjoining rooms and they got a huge room with a kitchenette and a sitting area. Their room had a queen size bed that looked like a murphy bed (pulled down from the wall). Our room had a king size bed. Their bathroom was smaller with one sink and our's had two sinks separated by a door. I thought the room configuration was a bit odd but I guess some people get both rooms together to make a suite? The check-in was quick and courteous. The room was really clean but a bit in need of repairs. Our toilet kept making a noise like it wasn't done flushing although the noise wasn't loud enough to bother us. The windows are single-pane which mad it a bit noisy. But we wereso tired from a day of shopping that we had a good night's sleep and slept very well on the comfy bed. We got a deal on the hotel so I was happy overall. I would definitely stay here again if I can get the same deal and I visit Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite Seattle hotel”
Reviews.Author: OFTravels
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Olympic is one of the best hotels in Seattle. They have several different room types to accommodate your needs. They have a fine work out area with machines and weights. An indoor pool, whirlpool, and a nice locker room. Headsets and bottled water are provided. If you sign up for the Fairmont's Presidents Club, you can enjoy free WiFi as well as other features. Slippers are provided in the room and you can ask for a coffee maker. A stocked mini-fridge and safe are already there. The location is great. Walking distance to many of Seattle's tourist areas and very near the bus hubs. The downtown area bus is free during the day. We've stayed here several times and have never felt the need to rent a car especially since parking is expensive and limited in the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “An ABSOLUTLY wonderful experience!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: texastiger12
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed five nights at this beautiful and elegant hotel. From the moment we arrived, everyone and everything was perfect. We arrived earlier than check in time, by several hours, but it was no problem, they had our room ready, but even if it wasn't they would have stored luggage till room was ready, then take it up fhere for us. We had a tour planned, so we needed to leave fairly soon for that. Our room was an executive suite and was most comfortable, with a huge bath, and french doors separating the sitting area from the bedroom. The bed and linens and pillows were first class....I am somewhat of a"snob" about good pillows and linens......that's a MUST for me. Nothing worse than those "hard" hotel sheets and pillows. Another plus, is the hotel car that is available first come, first serve, with very friendly and knowledgeable drivers....the service is free, but you do tip them, but so worth it....not to mention its a gorgeous black jaguar!!!! The concierge service was spectacular as well.....they made us reservations, and each time we were given complimentary appetizers at the restaurants....I can't say there was ANYTHING undone or not taken care of...the bar is lovely, we ate only at Shuckers, not The Georgian, but it was wonderful as well. Don't miss this jewel of a hotel!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Treatment Even Though Got a Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: sarahalta
Reviews.Content: -Had a great night of sleep--though I booked through discount site, I got an awesome room with 2 flatscreen TVs and a separate living room from the bedroom. -All details were perfect for me. I love a heritage style hotel. -The staff were *so* nice to me. I thought I would get the discount treatment but not at all. I had a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with Old world Charm”
Reviews.Author: RawFitness
Reviews.Content: I have always wanted to stay at the Fairmont after visiting the Teddy bear room each year during Christmas. My room was a suite with a king bed and pull out sofa. I loved the location and the staff. The health club was really plush with fresh fruit and water. I would have loved free Internet in the lobby but they did have a business room to print your boarding card.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Alexjamessabbymia
Reviews.Content: Yes, the building is old but that is the charm. Great location, good service and pool is nice. You will get what u paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: yemmer77
Reviews.Content: This hotel was incredible. My daughter and I stayed here on a recent trip to Seattle. It is conveniently located just a block away from the Link Light Rail which takes you directly to the airport. It is also a short walk to Pike Place Market, the monorail to the Space Needle and the cable car to Union Lake. The hotel is beautiful with a traditional lobby where you re greeted by staff who can't do enough to make sure your stay is perfect! The rooms have luxurious bath robe and slippers. There is also a sitting room with a flat screen television in addition to the bedroom with the television. The hotel is also child friendly and children receive complimentary milk and cookies at night. It is an immaculate hotel and everything was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Good except for the street noise!”
Reviews.Author: oranges8
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel except that you can hear street noise.The siren during the nights could be heard very clearly even on the top level.The room is pretty well insulated as you can barely hear any noise from the other guest rooms above or from the other side.We had stayed in a corner room.We are particular about noise coming from other guest rooms. The two restaurants, Georgian and Shuckers were extremely good.Highly recommended. It was such a shame that street noise could be heard for such a lovely hotel.Service was good even though the same concierge who helped us a couple of times was not very knowlegeable.It is centrally located downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, a bit out of the way... ..”
Reviews.Author: mahalia1980
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fairmont Olympic at the end of June and when getting there via Clipper the bordwalk area was extremely crowded and getting a taxi was impossible. Walking with a carry-on luggage up what was about 7 blocks (Seattle's actually very hilly, hillier then Sanfrancisco) was rather a challange and work out. When I got to the hotel I was greated by staff asking to assist me with my carry-on, wish that had been 8 blocks down the hill. The young lady that chcked me in was very nice and professional, her name was Emily. I asked her quite a few questions, all of which she answered and then when I looked back there was a big line-up and a concierge desk which I could've gone to, it was nice of her to help me. At at the little cafe a quick croissant and safe latte and it was lovely, like french patisserie. There was always someone present in the lobby so if I had any directions questions or recommendations there was always someone readily accesible to answer my questions. The pool and gym area were lovely as was the entry and sitting area and the shrubbery and outside of the property. The room was clean and fresh and I am rather particular about hotel cleanliness. The room was large and bathroom was very large. The windows were on level with other rooms windows making me feel uncomfortable to leave the window open at anytime in the case of a room invasion and fresh air would've been nice. The light above the sink was burnt and didn't really matter to me but that the maintenance person came within 15 minutes of me checking in to fix it, this should've been done prior to my check-in so, I declined him coming in and asked he return after I check-out. The only thing I REALLY didn't like about the hotel was that the location was a bit out of the way causing me to taxi many places and I like somewhere in a prime location so, I can walk everywhere. Again, had I had more time in the city perhaps the location wouldn't have been an issue but it was because I was pressed for time and seeing as it wa out of the way I took at least 6 taxis that could've been easily avoided. Other then this challange, the property was great!

Reviews.Title: “We got married here, and we return frequently!”
Reviews.Author: 2PhDs
Reviews.Content: This is without question the "Grand Dame" of Seattle Hotels. The exterior is classic, and upon entering the "Lobby", a grand mult-floor height marble hall, one feels like this is one of the grand European hotels. We were married here several years ago, in a small family-only ceremony in the Cascade Suite, a marvelous one-bedrom 3,400 sqft suite with a private dining room (where we had a private dinner served). Unfortunately, there is no way to make that into a suite with several bedrooms, despite the grand living area; the most that can be enclosed in privacy - and safety for young children - is with one other executive suite. Therefore, we've also stayed in the only 3BR suite in the Hotel (still not quite large enough for the family). As far as we know, the other corner suites are 2BR at most. Usually, when it is just the two of us, we stay in a large executive suite, and occasionally in the larger bedroom (part of the corner parlor suite that goes with the 2-bedroom suite... and with the one 3-bedroom suite). As wonderful as this hotel is, there are some problems with the heating system, such that it is tricky to get a room that isn't too warm. We now know which rooms to request, and we call ahead and remind the Front Desk staff that we'd like the thermostat turned "as cool as possible". The service here is absolutely the best. With special requests for a large extended family, the hotel staff came through with everything from tiny bathrobes for children (which we of course purchased for the grandchildren!) to getting a prescription refilled on short notice. And we've arranged special meals in the Georgian Room (the first time, when we could still hand-carry a special bottle of wine on board a commercial flight), and it was just perfect. We tried another hotel, and we walked out of the new Four Seasons (The Olympic *used to be* a Four Seasons), which was in one of the few seamy areas left in downtown. We then tried one of the new high-rise hotels, but it was like walking into the (small) lobby of an office building, simply to be spirited upstairs on the elevator right by the front door. (To due justice to this other Hotel, it did have a wonderfully huge and deep bathtub, with water that came out of the ceiling; if only our grandchldren could have seen THIS!) But the suite was just "another modern hotel suite", albeit one with very soothing displays on the walls, a very "zen" sensation to be sure, one lasting the full stay. The Fairmont Olympic has become "our home away from home" during our frequent and occasionally extended trips to Seattle and the surrounding area. Sign up for the FREE "PRESIDENT'S CLUB", which allows you free Internet Service.

Reviews.Title: “We've stayed 3 times and will keep going back!! Love it!”
Reviews.Author: happyroo
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Olympic Hotel is a great hotel in Seattle to stay at. It has consistently excellent service, helpful staff and a great location which is walking distance to Seattle shopping. The rooms are traditional and lovely, the beds comfortable with big cozy duvets. The pool & fitness facility are very well appointed with not many people around using it. The check in/out process was smooth as always...I have to say here that Fairmont is just a fantastic hotel group to stay with. One of the evening we stayed we were heading out to the Crab Pot for dinner and went down to get a cab...the doorman called the hotel car for us instead which was available and drove us to the restaurant for no extra charge...just a tip for the driver who gave us the card to call when we were reay to be picked up again. It was a 2011 Jaguar with all the bells and whistles which pleased my husband :) Every time we stay we always end up in the lounge to people watch, the service here is always excellent and the desserts are amazing. We always stay here at the end or beginning of a cruise as it is only 1 mile from the train station to go home after and a less than $20 cab ride to the port. I absolutely recomment this hotel to anyone travelling through Seattle, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable luxury in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: jaf_ta
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant two night stay at this majestic hotel. The doormen, valet, porters and front desk personnel were courteous, friendly and professional. The accommodations are superb.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded some expectations, a little subpar in others”
Reviews.Author: BusinessOrPleasure96
Reviews.Content: I've been aware of the Olympic for many many years, back when it was a Four Seasons property. Attended functions, eaten, had drinks but never actually stayed until now, so expectations were fairly high given it's long standing premier reputation. It retains the all feel of a classic grand old hotel inside. The public areas are very pleasant, fitness center and pool are appealing. The rooms are spacious, the beds extremely comfortable. Good sound isolation from other rooms and hallways though less so from the street even up on our 10th floor level. Our room was rather dark though with a single small window. A bit lacking in modern features though with no electrical outlets accessible except in the bathroom. No coffee makers are provided unless requested and we gave up waiting the first morning after an hour. TV channel volume defaults to deafening upon each switch on. Internet access a costly extra. Some of the furniture and carpets were looking very well worn and faucets will splash you at any opportunity. The room remained too warm overnight despite maxing out the AC and leaving the rather noisy fan on, and this was on a gray, overcast day. With the one exception noted above, the service was very prompt, polite and attentive. Clearly this is a top priority and it shows. It doesn't -quite- make up for the rather mediocre rooms for me though. I'm pleased to have sampled it but likely won't stay again when there are several other more modern choices nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Solrac24
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at the end of May on vacation. I had found a promotional rate through Orbitz that made the price reasonable,considering how expensive is Seattle. I did not find anything about this hotel that I can complaint about, it was simply excellent in all ways. The staff was very professional and helpfull, specially at the spa and concierge. the room was extremely well appointed, best bedding I ever experienced in a hotel, and the pillows were feather, the expensive ones. Robes and slippers, umbrella in the closet, along with the customary. a scale in the bathroom to see the damage done to the waistline. Make-up mirrors in the bathroom, extra thick towels, top end toilettries, everthing you would expect and require for a place that claims five stars. The spa facilities were top notch, along with the pool area and locker room. they provided complementary coffe, bottled water, apples, and papers at the spa/pol, so you could sit at the adjacent terrace and relax reading the papers (NY Times, USA Today and local), go for a soak and then change. All kind of tolettries available in the locker room, not just your shaving cream and cheap cologne. robes and slippers there too! The location is excellent, downtown, and one block from the skytrain station on Third Ave. This leaves you a twenty minute ride to the Seattle-Tacoma airport, extremely convenient if you are a mere pedestrian, which is highly recomended in Seattle. If you need transportation to visit something out of town, you can rent a car there, but ditch the rental immediately inSeattle and use the Skytrain!! the bars was excellent, with a nice happy hour and their food, starters, were pretty good. I will return again if money is no object!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: AHumphreys
Reviews.Content: Lovely, historic hotel convenient to all of Seattle's sights. Staff members were friendly and helpful and the hallways were so quiet. Easy to relax. Our room was a junior suite and was just lovely. Matress was divine!.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: thetourister
Reviews.Content: Comfortable stay. Friendly staff and clean rooms. Good location, couldn't ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “Solid performance but not over the top great”
Reviews.Author: rumbeam
Reviews.Content: I think Fairmont does a nice across the board -- have stayed in Fairmont in Maui, Chicago and Seattle. I don't love old school luxury so this hotel is not top of my list from a style perspective, but I love how roomy they are. I don't think this hotel is special if you're looking for an experience, but it's clean, has a few posh touches and is spacious. If you want comfort stay here. If you want a more quintessential urban vibe with a little luxe edge this Fairmont is not for you. The staff in the business center were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: kateharvey
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a family with 2 young children, we arrived late, they took the car, the luggage and just handed us our room key, no check in required which is perfect when you've got tired children. The room was big, the bed was comfortable, they even had 2 child sized dressing gowns. The staff were all lovely and helpful, the food was great (free breakfast for young children), nothing was too much trouble. I've stayed in a fairmont twice before and have never been disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Nice facility, quite pricey though”
Reviews.Author: NiklasPavelV
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. However, in line with the upscale level of the facility and Seattle downtown area, was very pricey. But if that is what you want this would be a good choice. Lots of food choices withing walking distance. Parking was horrible as expected downtown. Be prepared for a real workout with the up and down of the hills when walking. Rooms very nice, best I have stayed in for quite a while. Check in and out painless. Staff professional and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Grand old hotel oozes luxury”
Reviews.Author: GVancouver
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Olympic is a grand old hotel in the railway hotel tradition. The hotel though has kept up to modern standards. Very soothing and luxurious lobby. As soon as you walk in you relax and feel as if you should talk in hushed tones. The hotel is in a great location, close to the business, entertainment and shopping districts. Service was exceptional. My room key was waiting for me when I arrived so there was no hassle checking-in. I'm a member of Fairmont's Presdient's Club. I don't know if everyone can expect the same flawless, personalised service I got, but I suspect they treat everyone well. The lobby lounge is a nice spot for a drink, but there are more affordable equally pleasant bars within walking distance, notably Purple Restaurant or the W Hotel bar across the street. Avoid the over-priced hotel restaurant for breakfast and go to the Belle Epicurean coffee shop. It's attached to the hotel, accessed through the lower lobby. They serve the most decadent, freshly baked European style pastries. Yum! Luly Yang is a hidden shopping gem adjacent to the hotel. Walking by the display windows you might assume it's just a wedding and formal-wear store. That is it's primary focus, but hidden in the back is a small boutique for men. They have absolutely the best selection of ties I've ever seen. Lock up your Amex before you go unless you want to go home with a clutch of new ties. They also do custom made shirts and suits. Parking added $40 to the bill for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Found The Fairmont--No Need To Look Any Further”
Reviews.Author: GoWest77
Reviews.Content: We arrived via the Clipper Passenger Ferry from Victoria for an overnight stay at the Fairmont. It was about a 15 minute walk from the ferry terminal, Pier 69. We walked up through the Pike Place Market but we would recommend taking a taxi cab unless you have a backpack or manageable luggage & you can navigate hills & stairs. Upon checking in we were pleasantly surprised when given an upgrade to our room. Staff was friendly & helpful throughout our stay right from check in, to the fitness centre, restaurants, concierge & check out. We ended up in a bright, comfortable room with a view over downtown & the water. We spent a lot of time in the fitness/pool/sauna facility which was absolutely fantastic. In the morning I enjoyed a complimentary coffee bar down in the fitness area & had a chance for some quiet time to read the paper in the pool side lounge area. It was so peaceful & relaxing sitting in the courtyard looking out on the beautiful rhododendron trees. The staff (including the new trainees) working in the fitness area were courteous, respectful, helpful & fun. We were offered the hotel's town car service but it was a nice evening so we decided to walk to our destination. We had everything we needed in our room (makeup mirror, hairdryer, ironing board, & good quality bath amenities etc) which made the trip easy without having to carry all these items as walk on ferry passengers. We didn't have a car so there were no parking fees.We thought free internet was included with our package & upgrade but we could not secure a connection using our account #. Seems to be that we have been very disappointed with all the previous downtown Seattle hotels we've stayed at mainly for the reason that we never received the quality, comfort, service or value for the accommodations/hotel property we paid for. We have paid similar prices for other dismal & disappointing downtown Seattle hotels in the past but we now that we've found the Fairmont we don't need to stay anywhere else. Thank you Fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: CafeBohemia
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Olympic is a wonderful hotel in a great location in downtown Seattle. Spacious nicely decorated rooms. Great service. Excellent pool and fitness facility. Free wifi if you join Fairmont Presidents Club (free to join). Only downside: parking is very expensive so try to forgo a car (or park in cheaper lots nearby).

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous customer service”
Reviews.Author: merc_girl007
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairmont in April and thought the service was excellent. Happy hour in the cocktail bar was hosted five days out of seven by very pleasant staff. The concierge was extremely knowledgeable and charming. Sometimes five star hotel staff can be pretty snooty. I liked this place a lot because all the staff were friendly and extremely efficient. Food was good but pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel full of history but...............”
Reviews.Author: ozcc
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Fairmont Olympic, I had decided to book this as a bit of a treat as I had always wanted to stay at a Fairmont. The decor certainly didn't disappoint and the staff were wonderful, I was so excited when we arrived. Not long after we arrived I began to feel ill and had an asthma attack. The next morning I thought I may be able to shake it off so we went sight seeing but I was still not myself so we went back to the room to rest and as soon as I stepped into our room I was overwhelmed with chemicals and had a massive asthma attack, I could feel my face begin to puff up and I was very ill. My husband who never notices any thing said he could taste the chemicals. I knew I couldn't stay in this room or at the hotel but wasn't sure what to do so I called the front desk and Edward who is in charge of security came to see how I was doing, he said there was a car waiting to take me to the hospital, I declined as a hospital bill was the last thing I needed on a holiday. This was probably a mistake. Edward made arrangements to move us to another room and this room was a lovely suite but sadly I couldn't enjoy it as I was far to ill and just went to bed, so no sightseeing for me. Edward did say that they are soon to change to greener cleaners but at this stage they were still using harsh chemicals. What ever it was in that room was very harsh. The kindness of staff was so appreciated at this time. I later on had a visitor who had a reaction at the hotel when she went to the toilets in the hotel, so at this stage I am thinking this is not just me. I was feeling a little better the following day when we checked out but still had lumps over my torso which were itchy, so it wasn't fun. My two nights in Seattle were not my most memorable. I am afraid I wouldn't risk staying in another Fairmont hotel for my health which is sad as the hotels are all so beautiful with the best staff in the world who go out of their way to look after guests.

Reviews.Title: “As good as it gets in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: insecret9
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this property many times and are never disappointed. They were training some new staff and we had some problems with the room key, but this is a very rare misstep for this property. Room was super, ate breakfast in the Georgian Room twice- love the corned beef hash, and in general just love sitting in the wonderful lobby. As always, the floral settings were awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: BrookeinOregon
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice. We had a gift certifcate that we had purchased in a package at a school auction. The rooms weren't anything spectacular. Just a typical nice hotel room. The location was superb and we were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go. Baker parking was expensive but very polite and let us leave our car for the day we checked out so we wouldn't have to move it to another garage. Overall it was a nice fun weekend but I wouldn't pay the prices they ask for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Plush, comfortable base for exploring downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: haycritter
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont is a full service hotel within a grand architecture. The property is about 4 to 5 blocks from Pike Place making it a pleasant walk. Also, there are several restaurants within walking distance. If you want an old style hotel in downtown to allow you to explore downtown Seattle, I would recommend this hotel. This hotel is used by Holland America for cruise passengers arriving early. Transfer from the hotel to Pier 91, Holland's pier, is easy and fairly quick. Pier 91 is about 3 miles from the hotel. As a Holland passenger, I stayed here and it was a wonderful start to the cruise. I was able to enjoy discovering downtown the day before and the day of the cruise due to the hotel's location. This can be an expensive property. Be sure to shop for deals if you want to stay here. I got a decent rate as a Holland passenger.

Reviews.Title: “If you have the $, don't miss the Fairmont Olympic!”
Reviews.Author: montanalovevacation
Reviews.Content: I have been choosing vacation rentals for leisure trips as of late, and old-school charm isn't necessarily my thing, but I joined my mom at the Fairmont Olympic recently for a visit to Seattle. I now remember the many benefits of staying in a hotel, as the Fairmont Olympic provides excellent accommodations as well as outstanding service. If you want to treat yourself to a wonderful vacation in Seattle, then stay here! The staff exceed any expectations of good service, and bend over backwards to be helpful, gracious, and ridiculously accommodating. We stayed there on a "virtuoso" package which had so many benefits we couldn't even take advantage of all of them! If you want to be pampered and enjoy a PERFECT location, stay at the Fairmont Olympic! Also, check out the restaurant "Purple" across the street...yum!

Reviews.Title: “Slippery bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Versace_Wang
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed as the bathroom has marble floor with nothing separates shower and floor. Bathroom is very slippery after shower. Seniors to be aware The room is excellent except bathroom

Reviews.Title: “Love the Olympic!”
Reviews.Author: arachne
Reviews.Content: The Olympic is in a perfect downtown location, in a gorgeous, historic building. The rooms are large and thoughtfully decorated, and the beds are very comfortable. Even the windows open, which makes it a perfect hotel for me! Room service is expensive, but elegant and delicious. This is a great hotel to stay in if you're planning on walking around Seattle, going to Pike St market, waterfront, Benoroya Hall.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - highly recommend to anyone!”
Reviews.Author: LadyFinlandia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Fairmont Olympic hotel several times before and have always had such amazing service. This time we brought my 7 year old step-daughter and we ended up getting a suite. The room was amazing: so spacious and beautiful. We ordered room service. The food was excellent and portions were huge. The health club saff was very nice, and our little one could have spent all day in the pool. I will always stay here when in Seattle - without question!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, amazing bathroom”
Reviews.Author: carolina2323
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont Olympic for New Years, the room was beautiful and comfortable. I especially liked the vanity area, it was a perfect spot for getting ready without getting in each other's way. Ordered room service and our server was SO nice but the food could have been a little more fresh. Overall it was an elegant hotel, but not my all time favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Rooms & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ljcomp
Reviews.Content: We arrived with friends very late at night with lots of luggage and were relieved to be greeted at our cab by the Bellman with our room keys. What a delight to just go on up to our rooms which were huge. Seeing the rest of the Fairmont in the morning was a pleasant surprise - just beautiful!!! The lobby is fabulous and the restaurants very special. The only disappointment was not having a coffee maker in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: TheCatch
Reviews.Content: Just had a terrific 3 night stay at the Fairmont Olympic. Room was spacious and well appointed. Had very tasty late night in room dining - very generously sized chicken wrap and an ice cold beer the first night after late check due to 3 hour flight delay. In room ammenities included his and hers slippers, thick bath robes and wi-fi access (free to president club members) The gym and pool area is quite enjoyable- and the staff there is very accomodating. I would definitely stay here again... highly reccomended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at An Incredible Value”
Reviews.Author: london5288
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my 23 year old daughter for four days at the Fairmont Olympic, It was a great stay and we got an incredible value by using my Amex Platinum card. We received a free upgrade at check in as promised. The breakfast in the Georgian Room was excellent every morning with no service issues and delicious food. It was complimentary with my Platinum card benefits. After 10 days of dining all over Seattle and Victoria, my daughter selected our dinner at Shucker's as her favorite meal of the trip. We used the pool and enjoyed our time in the fitness center. There are some street noise issues but I am a light sleeper and I did not have a problem resting at the Fairmont. Our room was on the second floor but the traffic noise was not a problem for us. The hotel is Old World elegance and the ambience was just right for us. I will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, pleasant”
Reviews.Author: EastWestFamily
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night on a business trip. The hotel is centrally located, convenient to all business buildings in Seattle. The hotel was renovated quite nicely at some point, with elegant and spacious public spaces and meeting rooms on the ground floor and mezzanine. The small suite I had was on the third floor, nicely decorated. I could hear traffic to some extent, but it didn't bother me and I slept soundly. The room had all that I needed and the bed was very comfortable after I removed the heat-reflecting, synthetic mattress pad. The service was excellent all around, from doormen and bellboys always polite and available, to prompt and pleasant check-in, to responsive room service. The food and service for our business reception in the Garden Room was top drawer. One observation: the upstairs hallways and rooms seem to have reached the point of needing a re-do, just starting to appear a little tired. Otherwise, I have praise for this very nice establishment, and recommend it to business and family travelers.

Reviews.Title: “What a freefall for what was once a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: hotelfan
Reviews.Content: The Olympic was rebranded a Fairmount from the Four Seasons a number of years ago. Things made a fairly smooth transition until the "great recession" hit a couple of years ago. I appreciate that the economy fell off a cliff but sadly, one of its casualties was the Olympic. They have greatly reduced staff and it shows. The remaining staff remains upbeat and professional but there are not enough of them. I have stayed here at least annually since 1984. I used to think it was the best hotel in America. No more. The rooms are down at their heels. The fitness center and pool are stunning but filthy. The locker rooms are infrequently tended to so I found it trashed on 2 of the 3 visits I made there. They have some tables at the end of the swimming pool along w/a couple of loveseat sized seats all of which had garbage and food remnants under them. Our breakfast in the Georgian room was an absolute disaster. There were about 10 occupied tables and ONE person tending to all 10 tables. At one point the phone rang, and rang, and rang. Nobody ever picked it up but it rang, loud enough to be heard throughout the whole of that stunning room, for a good 3 or 4 minutes until whomever was calling gave up. Thank goodness. With the economy coming back, perhaps the ownership will spend the money it takes to return the Olympic to its former standing. However, they've lost me and my business. There is a new Four Season in town and the Pan Pacific has recently opened. The Inn at the Market is reliable. All in all, The Olympic has skidded so significantly that I have concluded that it's beyond repair. I shared all of this with the front desk manager when I left who expressed his sympathies. I wrote the general manager who sent me a generic letter that didn't even attempt to address the hotel's failures. After receiving his response, I'm convinced one of the hotel's failings is the general manager. Farewell The Olympic. It was a lovely relationship but it's over for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot in Downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: newschool_ski_bum
Reviews.Content: Recently travelled here with my fiance as we were visiting Seattle on vacation. One of the best check in experiences I have ever had. Since I am a member of the President's club, we did not even have to go to the reception, the doorman simply provided us with our room keys and we were off. Amazing! The hotel itself is older and charming. It has that kind of old elegance that you would expect from a Fairmont. The rooms are large and well appointed with flat screen TV's. The pool, gym and hot tub areas are great. Staff was helpful and accommodating. I really can't say anything bad about this place. Will definitely return next time I'm in Seattle. PS if you are looking for a good spot for dinner make sure to try out Purple next door. Amazing ambience, food and wine!

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy”
Reviews.Author: bugmum
Reviews.Content: This is really a lovely hotel with mostly good service. The downtown location is wonderful of sightseeing and shopping! But the serious downside is the noise from the street traffic. We were on the fourth floor and it sounded like trucks were about to drive through our room. Even with earplugs it was so noisy that we left feeling exhausted after our 2-night stay. The breakfast room service was very, very slow --- 45 minutes to get served.

Reviews.Title: “Professionally staffed and equally knowledgeable”
Reviews.Author: ForJVM
Reviews.Content: As a Fairmont club member, not all Fairmont's are equal but this hotel makes a good case to be considered at the top. Valet staff make every effort to greet you and help quickly and efficiently. Adding water bottles to the vehicle before leaving and ensuring you have directions to where you're going - Small details. Like remembering your last name when greeting you the next day. Rooms were slightly older than other Fairmront hotels, but hard to rate this hotel badly when the service and staff were as good. Asked for a Sunday NY Times at a very busy moment at the concierge desk, but they came thru without incident.

Reviews.Title: “Classy but friendly”
Reviews.Author: XtremeSoccermom
Reviews.Content: A girlfriend and I book a room through the Northwest Flower and Garden Show, and we weren't sure about the fact that our room would have two twin beds, which seemed to be the only room offered with two beds. I'm happy to say that the room was still spacious and comfortable, with nice furnishings, and the beds were comfortable with plush linens. Hotel staff were friendly and professional, and we were guided by them to local sights, shopping and restaurants. This is a first class hotel built in the 1920s, but seemed up to date in terms of furnishings. The hotel is located very central to Seattle's major attractions, with Pike Place Market and the Convention Center, as well as all the major shopping within walking distance. We walked everywhere, but were delighted to have free valet parking because of our hybrid vehicle. I requested a quiet room location, so we were facing the courtyard and it was very quiet given its downtown location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff - Building suffering”
Reviews.Author: Crticalone
Reviews.Content: We generally love Fairmont hotels. We went to this one for the location and the pool. You can skip it if you want a pool in the winter time. They keep the pool building FAR too cold for children or adults. The water temp was also a couple degrees too cold for this time of year.
