They also had two other big problems; (1) they were having mechanical problems which made hot water a challenge in our wing of the building. Nice! Go swimming with kids come back to give them a bath and only have tepidly warm water. Screaming followed. (2) The kitchen is under renovation, which meant a reduced menu and much slower room service. On the bright side, the staff really tried to accomodate and offered to move us to a different room or give us a price break. My advice though is to stay away until they finish the kitchen remodel and get their mechanical issues sorted out.

Reviews.Title: “Still a stretch to go before being a "real" Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: Reisender51
Reviews.Content: Good things first: The location is very close (1 block) to the Light Rail. So, when comming from the airport (or going to) it can be a smooth ride for just $2.50 plus a 3 minutes walk. The room/bathroom are roomy. The staff are very friendly. And a New York Times foc early in the morning is a good thing as well. What I didn't like: First of all - the breakfast. The price for an American b/f from the buffet is around $20 (plus tax). That's ok, considering the claimed standard of the hotel. There is no alternative to this buffet. So - no fried eggs, not even on request. Compared to international (and American) standard the size of the buffet can be called truly poor. The room need some renovation. There's no light in the wardrobe and at least one hand is needed to keep the doors of the wardrobe open. In this price class with the given size of the bathroom I do expect a seperate shower stall. And a hotel catering to international customers should have at least a kind of "universal" plug for the laptop (to be reached only on your knees under the desk) and for the razor (in the bathroom). Also to mentioned: The windows do not absorb outside noise very well. Ermergency vehicles (or motorcycles) could be heard throughout the night. Since I am a regular (international) Fairmont customer, I'd say: Still a stretch to go to catch up.

Reviews.Title: “Business Traveler's Perspective”
Reviews.Author: DCA
Reviews.Content: Most other reviews of this property are spot-on. Here's some info I would've liked to have known. I stayed in an Executive King room, which is one step up from the basic room. There's a bit more square footage, and a set of French doors to separate the sleeping and living room areas. If you're planning to work on a laptop during your stay, the size of the desk is inadequate and the outlets are on the wall under the desk. That's a bit of an inconvenience compared to the chains you probably stay at in other cities and expect outlets in the desk lamp or something. Wi-fi is spectacularly unreliable. You can log in and maybe get one or two actions to complete, but then it freezes up. Had I paid the $13.95 for it, I'd have been furious...but it's free for Presidents Club members. No issues with the cable, which works fine but chains you to that tiny desk. Not really sure it's worth the upgrade from the basic level room (which is why I'd chosen this room type...more space to work). Excellent service in the business center. I rented a room for meetings and the staff was impeccable. Always professional, with a friendly comment or funny quip here or there to keep a smile on your face. Breakfast service at the Georgian Room is hit-or-miss. Sometimes fantastic. Sometimes phoned in. Buffet is repetitive...eggs benedict four days in a row? Maybe it's because there was some sort of kitchen renovation going on, but still pretty lame for a hotel of this caliber. Food at Shuckers is awesome. Great local seafood goes into some really great chowders, and a crab louie salad that is as huge as it is amazingly tasty. Easy walk to malls (Pacific Place, Westlake Center), monorail to the Space Needle, and Pike Place Market.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jim104
Reviews.Content: i stayed here for one night as i visited Seattle while visitng family in Vancouver. The hotel staff we very good on check in, and the hotel was really nice. There was internet in the room which was very handy. The hotel is in a good location for wanting to see the city. I was only there for one night and it was a very comfotable stay, i would recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “I would got here again”
Reviews.Author: foreverdrunk
Reviews.Content: We stood there back in September 09. We had a great time. The hotel is very good with an old charm. I would give it 5 starts if not for the rooms. Some of the furniture was outdated. Yes, I realize this is an old hotel but some of the furniture could use some care. Other than that, excellent service, staff and location. I miss Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Old world charm and splendor is memorable.”
Reviews.Author: cottagevictoria
Reviews.Content: After a hiatus of many years, my husband and I returned to Seattle and out of all hotels available we chose the Fairmont Olympic. There is nothing to surpass the old world charm, the architectural details and elegance of this heritage building. The staff from the doorman to the concierge were gracious ,friendly, a fountain of knowledge and made us feel welcome. Our corner room was light and airy with elegant window dressings and furnished with faux antique style. Everything was spotless, the bed very comfortable and we felt pampered. We had trouble with our ipad connection and the telephone technician for the hotel was patient and efficient. After a long walk we decided to dine downstairs at "Schuckers" Good choice for us. The fresh seafood was perfect. Yes! we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “When can we move in?”
Reviews.Author: gumshoe_writer
Reviews.Content: We have driven past Seattle many times, but this was our first stay. We loved this hotel. The lobby has been beautifully restored, and the history was fascinating. - Room: Very clean, comfortable bed. Huge bathroom in our suite (but no shelves under the large sink area, so everything was either on the floor or the counter). Towels were stored over the toilet instead of beside the shower, which was a little odd. - Service: Excellent everywhere. - Hotel shops: A little sparse; the clothing shops are not inviting. They seem almost too exclusive. - Location: A short walk in either direction to get to shopping, restaurants, etc. We didn’t need the car (or even a taxi) once. - Streets: Very clean in the area we were in. - Underground tour in Pioneer Square: fascinating! - Pike Place Market: A leisurely 15-minute walk (but uphill on the way back) - Restaurants: We tried Shuckers (in the hotel), Metropolitan Grill, and Capital Grill – all three were a little pricey but the food was great. The Capital Grill actually decorated the table for my birthday, provided a card, and a free dessert (on about an hour’s notice). Our only complaint about the area was that we were in the birthplace of Starbucks, and they all closed by 6 p.m.! We like coffee after dinner, so we thought that was more than a little strange. Many shops in the immediate area were closed on Sunday.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite what I expected.”
Reviews.Author: MissKitty2
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel based on its close location to Benroya Hall. While the hotel and lobby are beautiful, the rooms leave a lot to be desired for a 4/5 star hotel. Our room was small and the furniture looked outdated. The amenities were fine (soap, shampoo/conditioner etc.) but our bath robes were a mess! One had a giant hole in the arm and the other was frayed at the sleeves. It was also difficult to get a good night's sleep because you could hear so much noise from the street. (old windows) On the positive side, the service at the hotel is outstanding and the lobby lounge is great.

Reviews.Title: “Slash 40% off of the price and i would probably stay again”
Reviews.Author: srtghwrthwrt
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby, swiiming pool and restaurant were great. The rooms on the other hand were only above average, the sleep quality was the same as what i would get at a best western and the fact that you have to pay extra for parking when i had already paid a rediculously high amount for a standard room. The fact that the hotel is located in downtown seattle is a good reason to pay a little more but paying extra for the extravagant interior decorating made the cost of this hotel not worth the price. Slash 40% off of the price and i would probably stay again, downtown seattle isn't Maui or Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “The Fairmont never disappoints!”
Reviews.Author: JCarlson1
Reviews.Content: This Fairmont lives up to the name! Situated in an historic building; walking distance from Pikes Place Market, countless great restaurants, shopping, and the Seattle Art Museum, it is in the perfect location for your stay in Seattle. The service is excellent from the valet to the concierge, to reception to all of the staff. Old world charm and elegantly decorated for the holiday season. I love the Fairmont and it will continue to be my hotel of choice wherever I travel.

Reviews.Title: “The Grand Dame of Seattle Hotels”
Reviews.Author: MonkeyGreen
Reviews.Content: I had not stayed at this property since the change of management from the Four Seasons but the transition was seamless and the service is better than ever. Having been raised in Seattle, I would describe this as the town's version of The Plaza. A place to come for tea in the Atrium or an "event" meal in the Georgian Room. There are certainly newer options in town but this is old school excellence. Great place to stay during the holidays!

Reviews.Title: “Understated Elegance”
Reviews.Author: msfpower
Reviews.Content: A great hotel -- big, comfortable rooms; helpful, friendly staff; history; well-maintained; great location; an elegant, old-style hotel that knows how to treat its guests. Plus a nice fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “Great lobby and service rooms can pick up traffic noise”
Reviews.Author: yreme
Reviews.Content: Due to the location and the service I tend to stay here despite the street noise so I am biased in that basis. Pro's- customer service top notch lobby and lobby bar very good location tough to beat for walking Con's- They got rid of in room coffee service you need to go to the lobby to get it The rooms loud, a lot of traffic noise Price can vary greatly depending on which web site you search on. The hotels web site is the highest pricing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: whatupdude
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Seattle. It was our first time. What a great city. The Fairmont is centrally located and was great place to stay. The service was fantastic the hotel is very clean. I can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Pampered!”
Reviews.Author: mariemtc
Reviews.Content: We just spent the weekend at the Fairmont Olympic and have to say it was fabulous! From dropping the car off with valet to checking in which was super quick and easy to arriving at our room...which was gorgeous... we had a great time. What a nice surprise to find our room was actually a suite. A relaxing sitting room leading to the bedroom (with pretty french doors) with a comfy king size bed and then on to the large bathroom.The bathroom had everything you could need. There was even a nail file which I happened to need. Our sitting room had a CD player with a "lounging" CD that was great to play while having cocktails. While we did not eat at either of the 2 restaurants we did try the coffee and pastry shop on Sunday morning... OH MY! Quite possibly the best latte I have ever had. And being from Seattle I am quite the coffee snob...sorry but true... another unexpected surprise came when the valet brought our car and gave us a little bag with cookies and milk! Who does that? I can only say I have found a new favorite place to stay in down town Seattle. What a great location, close to S.A.M. (Seattle Art Museum) We went to the Picasso Exhibit (easy walking distance)...this is a MUST see while it is here in Seattle..... also went to Pikes Market to pick up fresh crab to take home for dinner (easy walking distance...had to take a cab to the Seattle Pacific Science Center (too far for us to walk) to see the Bob Marley Laser light show (very fun) and to the Harry Potter Exhibit (great exhibit). In any event a great location close to the Fifth Ave Theater and all you could want to do downtown. Will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “An Old Classic worthy of a Visit”
Reviews.Author: Cepage
Reviews.Content: Well located and oozing of old style luxury, the old Olympic Hotel has been reborn as the Fairmont Olympic, having previously been run under other names including fairly recently as the Four Seasons Olympic (now replaced with a new Four Seasons in Seattle). The hotel is old and shows it, but has been modernized and is quite serviceable. The location is great. There are deals to be found on this hotel which make it relatively reasonable in price, around $185/night, which in comparison to what else you can get at that price in Downtown Seattle is not bad. The fitness center is nice, and the in room internet works well. You can get both for free by enrolling in the Fairmont Presidents' Club, which is also free to join. It is a block from a station for the new Airport light rail system. I would not hesitate to stay here again, if the price were right.

Reviews.Title: “great location, excellent service, but disappointed with the quality of the room”
Reviews.Author: chknuggts
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 3 nights and thought the location was perfect. The hotel is beautiful (in an upscale traditional way), but the room itself was a bit disappointing. The walls are pretty thin, and I was woken up in the middle of the night by people walking down the hall. My biggest complaint though is the bed! It felt like it was sagging in the middle and I woke up with back pain every morning :(. so overall, it was a nice, well located hotel with wonderful staff. But the room and mattress could use some updating.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel”
Reviews.Author: doublefault2
Reviews.Content: The moment you arrive at the front door you know you are at a top quality hotel. The front desk people are most professional and helpful. The rooms are very comfortable. The staff is excellent. The restaurants are good. Unlike many hotels today, you can get an a la carte breakfast in the main dining room or downstairs coffee shop rather than being forced, for lack of alternatives, into an expensive buffet breakfast.. Other premium hotels should take note. The only negative at the hotel was the $5.00 for 10 minutes charge to use the business center computer just to obtin a boarding pass. Hotels that have high computer useage charges should re-think that strategy as it is annoying.

Reviews.Title: “The usual Fairmont Attitude: Absolutely Superior”
Reviews.Author: sullific
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fairmont Chateau Frontenac a couple of years ago and raved about the service; this hotel is in every way its equal. Nobody can match Fairmont's service. There were no coffee makers in the suite here, which surprised me. I casually mentioned it to an employee and within an hour there was someone at the door with a tray: coffeemaker, coffee, etc, When I mentioned I'd wanted tea and could he bring some tea, he took the whole shebang and returned with a tea kettle, an assortment of teas (heavy on the requested Earl Grey) and not just the requested Splenda but the equivalent of an entire box of Splenda. All presented beautifully. Rooms are spotless, room service prompt and tasty,The Georgian restaurant the most elegant surroundings for poached eggs you'll ever have. I just can't say enough about it. This is what five-star really is.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel but a bit disappointed”
Reviews.Author: amk54
Reviews.Content: Good location, nice staff, very very good restaurants. But the room was a bit too noisy (probably because of the pool's ventilation) and we could only sleep 5 hours. We appreciated the fact that we did not have to check out before noon as we got up at 10 am and we could enjoy a delicious continental breakfast. We chose the "staycation" option. Breakfast and parking were included which was great. But when we picked up the car, the attendant said we had not paid for the parking and he refused to let us go. So we had to go back to the hotel and get from the receptionist the proof of our payment. That was a bit annoying since we were in a hurry. But overall, we enjoyed our stay there and we might come back but not to stay in the same room.

Reviews.Title: “clean as a whistle !”
Reviews.Author: Glama22
Reviews.Content: Not only are the rooms very clean and dust free but they have a complimentary car that will drive you with in the area to any restaurant you may want to go to and the drivers are so nice. This was great since we were two woman visiting, felt safe. Also ,on the side of the hotel there is a cute French cafe for coffee and breakfast that is fast and reasonable !

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently Located, Beautiful, and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Tanakainmaui
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Fairmont at about midnight. Although there was no one at the front doors, we found our way into the hotel. This is the first hotel that I've been in that you need to go up a short escalator before you get to the front desk. Luckily we didn't have that much luggage so we took our bags with us. The man at the front desk was very friendly and helpful. And he remained that way throughout our stay. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The interior of the hotel was very ornate and warm and welcoming. I also saw a couple of people with dogs, so I'm assuming that it is a pet friendly hotel. We had breakfast at the Georgian (I think that's what it was called) almost every morning. The staff there was also very friendly and focused. They have a heated indoor pool, which unfortunately, I didn't get to use. Also, they have a nice spa area. Pikes Market is about four blocks away. Westlake Mall is about four blocks away too. There's a Borders and a Sephora about two blocks away. The area around the hotel seemed safe. We walked around a lot both during the day and during the evening. We didn't feel uneasy or nervous at all walking around at night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but I think I expected a bit more”
Reviews.Author: BrisHappyChappy
Reviews.Content: I really don't want to put this hotel down because it is an excellent hotel, but I think I was hoping for a bit more from our stay. The main foyer and reception area is really nice and all the staff were very friendly. I did get the impression that the vast majority of people staying here were on business trips rather than pleasure, I'm not sure if this took a bit of charm away from the atmosphere. I think my main disappointment was probably with the view from our room. We were staying here on our honeymoon so I was hoping that we might have had a nice view across the city or something but we ended up on the second floor with the view of a wall. Literally 10 feet away from both of our windows was another wall. If you crouched down and looked right up you could just see the sky but it made the room very dark - even when we had really sunny days. It was also quite noisy, mainly from street noise. I know we were staying in a busy city but I don't think being on the 2nd floor really helps you to get away from the noise of the traffic. Like I said at the beginning, this is a very nice hotel and is worth a visit but I would recommend you try to get a room on one of the upper floors if you can. About a week earlier we had spent a night about 6 blocks away in the Warwick. While this wasn't quite as prestigious, I was really pleased with the Warwick, so I don't think this helped my opinion for the 5 star Fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “A Life of Luxury”
Reviews.Author: LizLuton
Reviews.Content: We spent nearly a week at this hotel. Our room was very comfortable and with almost everything we needed - some means of making hot drinks would have been welcome. The Hotel has two restaurants and a Bistro style French cafe. The food was excellent and the service was very good. The Hotel is in a central position, handy for Amtrak, the buses and with a flat rate of $32 for a taxi to the airport. We left our computer off as we felt the charge for Wifi was excessive. However, if I go back to Seattle, I would probably choose the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “In the Lap of Luxury at the Fairmont Olympic!”
Reviews.Author: SisterMoon_8
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel to Seattle at least twice a year. My husband's son has lived there, with his wife (and their soon to be born little baby daughter) for well over 10 years. We have stayed at many hotels over the years, but the Fairmont Olympic outshines them all. The service, the decor, the restaurants, the rooms, and the staff are wonderful. Last time we stayed, it was our son's wedding, and we had the Grandkids for one evening, (4 of them, from Don's Daughter and son-in-law) and they could not have been more helpful to us. We tooks the kids to their lovely indoor pool, and the kids had a ball. We served the kids dinner at the pool, and we made quite a mess, but the staff came and cleaned it all up, no worries. They have good kid's choice movies on the telly, and so we were able to start a movie and keep the kids occupied until their parents picked them up. The suites are lovely, and comfortable, with lovely, big bathrooms, great massaging shower heads, and the beds are comfortable and luxurious, offering a great nights sleep! The SPA is lovely, and we have enjoyed massages there, too. Shuckers offers that fantastic Seattle seafood in a clubby, old-Seattle atmosphere with yummy preparations, and there are plenty of kids choices on the menu. The lovely bar in the lobby is so classic, and serve wonderful drinks in an old-world style, that we really appreciate. The Georgian is GORGEOUS, and the food is wonderful. Don't be intimidated by the grand decor, and give it a try. We love it there and this is where they serve their wonderful breakfasts. I feel like a Queen when I am dining there! Their location is great, not too far from the Public Market and the downtown restaurants, shopping and the amazing Seattle Aquarium. They are also around the corner from Benaroya Hall and many Art Museums, for a little culture. Whenever we visit Seattle, it's the Fairmont Olympic for us!

Reviews.Title: “YOU MUST STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: Matty
Reviews.Content: What can I say, but almost perfect. I stayed here with a mate while we did the Boeing tour. I didn’t expect anything as good as the Fairmont Quebec, but the staff and quality of hotel was brilliant. Compare this hotel quality to the Roosevelt that i stayed at in Hollywood which is more expensive, there is no comparison. The Fairmont hotels in my opinion are 5 star world class. Tip: for gents when staying at a Fairmont hotel and dining in a restaurant...take a dinner shirt otherwise you will stand out like a sore thumb, luckily I had one. “The Georgian” restaurant in this hotel was exceptional. From the greeting at the door by name on arrival to check out, this hotel is great. The hotel courtesy car privilege was a bonus treat.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Old World Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leerja74
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. Built in the twenties and the lobby and Georgian Room (breakfast and dinner eating room) are very much of that era. Staff very friendly and helpful. Rooms are reminiscent of the fifties but are in top condition and have modern facilities. Expensive place to stay but it is a 5 star hotel after all.

Reviews.Title: “Worth Every Penny and Dog Friendly Too”
Reviews.Author: momstephano
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay here, it was very elegant and a lot of fun to be had in and around the hotel. The first night we ate at the restaurant in the hotel called Shucker's. We set out looking for a place with a patio so the pooch could eat with us, and we walked outside and around the corner and there was Shucker's patio, I went inside and asked if the dog could sit with us and they said ok. The room was very comfy and the couch was great for watching TV. They had a silver tray with two dog bowls and some bones waiting in the room for Ginger.The bathroom was very large and the shower was one of the best Ive had. Everything is top notch here. Join the presidents club when you check in and you will get free internet .We went around town with the dog, We caught a bus down to the terminal, we took her on the ferry, then caught a taxi after we got back to Pikes Place market, and walked around there, then another bus ride. She was welcome in all the rides and such. She was one tired girl last night. We had a great stay here in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Comancheflyer
Reviews.Content: We had stayed here for a night and had a wonderful stay. The room was elegant and well coordinated , the King bed was comfortable and the cleanliness of the room was superb.The location of the hotel was great, right in the heart of Seattle. Overall we had a great stay and will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at this Fairmont Hotel if road noise bothers you”
Reviews.Author: concertgoerNc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont Hotel in late August, and were very disappointed with our stay. We chose this hotel on our first trip to Seattle due to a great corporate rate, and also the good reputation generally of Fairmont hotels. When we checked in, I asked for a quiet room because I don't like road noise. They assigned us a room on the third floor, which concerned me but the check-in staff assured me that our room was in a quiet location. When we got to our room, we saw that it overlooked a busy road. We immediately requested a room change but the hotel could not accomodate us - the only option they could give us was a room near the elevator, which is also a noise problem. So we spent several sleepless nights listening to cars zoom by and the hotel did not apologize and did nothing to improve our experience. Do not stay at this hotel if road noise bothers you - each side of the hotel faces a different street, so there aren't many quiet options. Next trip to Seattle I will definitely stay at the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: fletch30
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in great location. Very elegant decor. Spacious, well decked out rooms with the best pillows I have ever slept on. Easy walking to everywhere. Outstanding service and great health club/fitness facilities. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not a good room”
Reviews.Author: zguby
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 2 nights in a room on 2nd floor near the spa (226) We ordered a kink size bad and what we got was not in the proper size . The woman at reception told me that this is the size and she can not do anything to change it. There were a lot of people coming and going near our room The room was large and had good amenities The location of the hotel is perfect for touring Seattle

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Hotel/ Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cineteach
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Seattle and spent two very comfortable nights at the Fairmont. Some of the reviews mention that the hotel has an older, tired look. We thought it was lovely. The rooms was a delux king, which was perfect in size and the bathroom was quite spacious. Overall, the room was spotless. Checking in at the front desk was a breeze and the reception clerk was most helpful in giving us directions to Pike's Market and several restaurants we wanted to try during this trip. On our second day we returned to the hotel about 3:00 and stopped in at Shuckers for happy hour. The beer and wine was just a few dollars and the appetizers, which were delicious, were truly a bargain. We loved walking down to Pikes Market and had dinner the first night at "Matts at the Market" The food there was fresh and prepared beautifully. It was informal, friendly and the food and service were both excellent. We would definitely stay again at the Fairmont when we return to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “excellent plush retreat”
Reviews.Author: Mike_J1963
Reviews.Content: top-notch location, superb room service and professional all-round. Very comfortable and clean and cushy rooms. Obviously pricey but you get what you pay for in this one

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: RyanM7
Reviews.Content: Seattle is such a great city. There is so much to do and see, shopping, restaraunts, almost like a little Manhattan with more outdoor activites and natural beauty. The Fairmont is right in the middle of it all. Walk out the door or even just into the lobby for the best shopping, sophisticated, old-world architecture and decor. Within easy distance of Nordstrom's, Seattle Center, the Art Museum, Pike Place Market. A perfect option for anyone willing to spend a little more money for one of thebest hotels I have ever stayed in personally.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service in lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pequeno_Planeta
Reviews.Content: A grand hotel, as you'd expect from its 5 stars and the price, but what really makes it stand out is the fantastic service we got from everybody. For example, the concierge who went the extra mile to explain to us in detail bus routes to Ballard and how to walk the locks to Discovery Park, the barman who has worked there for years and takes pride in explaining the history of each cocktail you choose. Basically every member of staff we came across, from chambermaids to front desk to porters to member of staff in charge of gym/pool seemed to take a real professional pride in providing service with a smile. Superb.

Reviews.Title: “A touch of Old world luxury”
Reviews.Author: FunOnly
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont as a break from an 18 day boating trip. We had stayed at the Fairmont chain in Whistler, Banff and Lake Louise in the past and were delighted that the Fairmont Olympic surpassed our previous stays. We took the bed and breakfast package and were rewarded with a 5 star meal each morning. The room had a separate sitting area and each had a flat screen television. Everything was 5 star including a complimentary Lexus limo that would take you to any destination downtown - note the limo will not take any luggage

Reviews.Title: “Best of Seattle”
Reviews.Author: goodwig
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Pan Pacific on front end of Alaskan cruise trip and Fairmont at back end; which was a smart choice for a day in Seattle after a week on the sea. The Fairmont is a superior hotel and situated (downtown) perfectly for a visit to Seattle. Rooms are truly luxurious and the indoor pool complex is top-rate and a perfect way to sit and relax, read, use the oversized whirlpool, or the health club. Lobby is spacious, rooms and hallways are brightly and exquisively decorated, and the hotel has a nice bar, breakfast room, and restaurant. Bargain rates can be gotten by surfing the various websites. I am a very discriminating traveler and this hotel met my highest expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what service”
Reviews.Author: sofiteme
Reviews.Content: We were there for 3 nights during the 4th of July weekend. The hotel was oversold, and we got there late in the afternoon from our drive up. Our reservation was upgraded to a gorgeous 2-bedroom suite. The concierge was super nice, helpful, knowledgeable about restaurants nearby and yoga studios. Great location, walking distance to shopping and Pike Place. Now if only the weather fairy could have made the city 15 degrees warmer and sunnier instead of mostly rainy and grey. It would have been perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent quality, location and service”
Reviews.Author: mellykins153
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Fairmont. The location was perfect and was within walking distance from Pike's Market. The rooms were elegant and well appointed. The toiletries were nice, and a bathrobe was provided. Service was top notch the entire time. The pool and fitness area were spacious and well maintained. I also had great seafood at one of their restaurants, Shuckers.

Reviews.Title: “Don't blow a good thing with bad customer service”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler1300
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on the way to Alaska. We chose it for its location, history, architecture and relative ultra comfort. The building is attractive, the food and beverage - albeit pricey - good, the rooms clean. Check in was smooth --- polite. But the concierge desk was another thing and it tainted the stay. I requested 20 post card stamps. OK - maybe more than the average person asks for - but it was a small battle with the concierge to sell them to me. She explained she could only sell 5 to me since they were saving them for other guests if they asked. --- And she battled back and forth not offering another option - no hotel in the area would have them, no - the post office would be closed and so on. I continued to explain that I would happily go somewhere to buy them - but no - she could not help. I asked for a gift shop and she said they MIGHT have some a couple of floors down. And indeed they did - a whole bunch of them AND the post office was open the next morning. What was the need to battle about post card stamps when she could have replenished them either fromt he gift shop or from the post office? This is not what I expected at the Fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury hotel with family amenities”
Reviews.Author: alm3d8
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the large pool area and dined and played there. Close to lots of attractions and shopping. Nice, clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Three Nights of Golden Treatment”
Reviews.Author: ILove2Travel80
Reviews.Content: Bellhops, concierge, maids, valet, gym attendants - all great. I couldn't be more pleased with my stay at the Fairmont in Seattle on July 2, 2010 weekend. The bed was comfortable; the executive suite was nice, clean and roomy. The amenitites were great. Very state of the art fitness machines, LOVED the pool with the glass class and ceiling. I hung out in the hot tub and the suana. They provided everything I needed to walk out of the gym with a smile. Concierge was very helpful and recommended some great locations. Alway book through them! The cookies and milk in our car from the Valet on our way out was a perfect ending to a perfect weekend. I wouldn't go back to Seattle, but I'll definitely stay with Fairmont again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Historic Property, Impeccable Service”
Reviews.Author: joecdn
Reviews.Content: There were a number of us staying at this hotel for Seattle Pride weekend. The check-in process was friendly, professional and efficient. We had a ton of luggage, and the bellman did a good job dispatching it in a timely fashion. The front desk agent was responsive to our requests, and was immediate in pointing out a service interruption that was going to occur as a result of the Seattle Pride Parade. I found the hallways of the hotel a bit like something you'd see in the Shining - but the lobby was incredible! Our room was tastefully appointed, with a nice marble bathroom and furnishings that fit the era of the room. The flat screen TV in the armoire was quite a bit larger than is typical in luxury hotels, and the minibar was well-stocked. The bellman was very accommodating when it came to the champagne we had brought ourselves - fetching us a champagne bucket with ice, as well as several champagne flutes. Overnight room service was better than expected - with numerous hot items available to order. The pool and fitness center were great - the attendant in the fitness center offered us bottled water as we entered. Overall I would say that the decor is very nice, and the service stood out as impeccable. I'd definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel and very centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Supratikban
Reviews.Content: Fantastic rooms, spacious and great views. Very elegant in-house restaurant and great location. Staff were very welcoming. Close to downtown shopping and sights and yet away from the noise.

Reviews.Title: “A ripoff”
Reviews.Author: nejf68
Reviews.Content: For the price they charged, I expected more than tiny uncomfortable beds in a cramped room. The extraneouse fees, such as $15/ night for internet and $25 to empty the mini-bar to use as a fridge were other unpleasant surprises. Would never stay at this place again--would have stayed at a Motel 6 if I'd known this place would be such a ripoff.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest hotels we've stayed in !!”
Reviews.Author: villasequim
Reviews.Content: We can be nervous about staying in older hotels but we were pleasantly surprised at how beautiful and well kept the Fairmont is.... Everyone ( staff - employees ) --- and I mean everyone that we encountered at the hotel was friendly and gracious. We were made to feel comfortable and welcomed at each turn... We stayed in a King room with a sitting area and it was huge....We especially loved the milk and cookies in our car on the way out of the hotel ... what a nice extra touch... We would recommend this hotel to anyone and will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “A Luxurious Historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travel_LadyNYC
Reviews.Content: This is an upscale, luxury historic hotel in a great location with impeccable service which I was able to book ahead of time/non-refundable for the astounding price of $200. Okay, I could only have two twin beds; it was worth it. Front desk, concierge, restaurant staff and everyone else we came in contact with across the board were welcoming and solicitous. The concierge was not only knowledgeable about the city; she was tuned into the kind of dining experience and activities that we were looking for. The expansive common area seating areas are serene; comfortable chairs and small tables abound around which you can have quiet meetings. The hallways are elegant and clean with very fresh air – actually our hall way was a little Arctic, but I’d go for that over stale air any time. Our Room -- Understated, and spacious. Windows that open; comfy beds, very nice linens; tasteful art, nicely framed; pretty lamps; CD player; comfortable chair and ottoman; armoire and side table; spacious desk. You do have to pay for Wi-Fi. The Closet – Extra blankets and towels; a good quality umbrella in case it rains; wood shoe horn and brush; a basket to leave your shoes out for shoe shine; both wooden and quilted hangers; an extra lower shelf; two pairs of complimentary slippers and two (not complimentary) bathrobes. (At least I think the slippers were complimentary …) The Bathroom – Well-lit; high quality amenities (however, one of the soaps was so highly fragranced that I actually had to put it in a drawer); a number of extra hooks and bars and an extra shelf; magnifying mirror; scale; elegant shower curtain. Now normally I wouldn’t notice or comment on a shower curtain, but really every detail in this hotel just cries out to you (softly). Although the toilet was in the same room as the shower, it was tucked away. The Fitness Center – Very good, with a variety of weight and cardio machines. However, there is not much floor space, so if you have a dedicated yoga practice, you better hope that there is not someone else who is doing their kickboxing or Pilates at the same time. They offer fabulous coffee, complimentary water and apples. Be forewarned: there was quite a crowd there on a weekday morning at 7:00 a.m. The Restaurant –The food is excellent; very creative without being wacky. We had breakfast there twice and lunch once. Depending on your pocketbook, you may feel that the food is expensive. In that case, if you are a foodie, you may want to splurge, because the food is amazing. This is a fine dining experience; with a business casual dress code. I would not bring children here, unless they are extraordinarily well-behaved. This is among the best hotels I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “They could do a bit better”
Reviews.Author: SOStravellers
Reviews.Content: We had originally booked a deluxe king room B&B package and had invited a friend, so there were three of us plus our pet, when I called to ask about the room arrangement, we were informed that the rooms only had (2) twin beds which would obvisously not comfmortable enough for three people. When we got to the hotel, we were greeted by the valet parking, we paid 36 dollard as opposed to the 26 dollar self parking option. The lobby area was quite impressive and the front desk agent very friendly and informative, made our pet feel very welcome with a nice treat and she gave provided us with all the information about the hotel. We inquired about upgrading to a one-bedroom suite and we only had to pay 30 dollars for the upgrade which was nice. The suite was nicely decorated but quite small, even as a one-bedroom suite. The bathroom looked as it had been recently upgraded. We were a bit surprised to find that the french doors only have thin drapes, but no glass, so there is really no privacy. The suite looked even smaller once we pulled out the sofa bed. Pet services are quite pricey, 25 dollars per hour for a dog sitter and 10 dollars for a 5 minute pee/pooo walk. We ordered room service, which was excellent. We were also surprised to know that the breakfast credit was only 56 dollars, and the agent did not actually explained that it works out ok as long as you go for the breakfast buffet, which we had decided not to go for, so we were charged about 15 dollars as breakfast overage. Check out was a bit slow, but again, the agent was in training. Overall, a nice hotel with lovely rooms, a bit small and good food and location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, be careful on reservations”
Reviews.Author: jmatl
Reviews.Content: We got a discounted deal on this nice hotel, although it was the most expensive hotel we stayed in on our two week trip. We were not informed that the reduced rate deal basically meant a much smaller size handicapped room - not that it was that inexpensive. The address can be confusing if you don't already know where it is. If you're not taking a cab there, be sure and call and get the location; when google maps had problems and the address similarly was inaccurate somehow. Very nice door staff. The hotel bar closes what I deem to be a little early. Nice hotel. If you want a nice view of Elliott Bay, don't stay here. On balance, a nice historic hotel well located in Seattle. Possibly expensive relative to value, but Fairmont isn't known for being cheap anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: bucsuz
Reviews.Content: Great stay at the Fairmont for 6 nights. Excellent service from the minute you wall in. Shuckers offers a GREAT Happy Hour selection and prices. Good fitness facilities as well. Centrally located, everything in walking distance. Classic old style hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Earth3003
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful and if you get to stay in one of the suites which features a living room, you will very much enjoy it. The bathtub is just slightly dated, but that is the only complaint about the decor that one can have. You get all of the standard Fairmont toiletries, like lotion. The breakfast, while pricey, is delicious. The windows open, which is a treat in a US hotel, I think, and you get to enjoy the nice mild Seattle weather. Beware that the water in the room is incredible pricey (it was over $7 a bottle if I remember correctly) and there were also various candy in the living room, but I could not figure out how much they cost. There was no minibar. Internet access is not free. The location is right in the heart of the Seattle downtown, with some restaurants and stores within walking distance, and certainly the waterfront and Pike's market within walking distance (about 10-15 minutes). Beware that this is a hilly city! Also beware that the traffic can get bad at rush hour. I believe that parking is expensive, but I was with colleagues and was not the one taking care of the parking. The check in staff are very helpful and were happy to print boarding passes. Overall, if you get a good deal, this is a great hotel and offers exactly what one would expect from a Fairmont; but as with all expensive hotels, it seems you get less for free (like internet or breakfast).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Zahava
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Fairmont! It is centrally located to all in Seattle (shopping/arts/port). The service is beyond reproach. I am very surprised it is not a higher rated hotel for Seattle-I would not hesitate to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A nice slice of luxury”
Reviews.Author: Ozgypsay
Reviews.Content: We don't normally stay in 4 or 5 star hotels because of the cost and because we very rarely spend any time in them when on holiday; we're too busy getting out and about. However, with only one night in Seattle, lots of time visiting friends, and a 2 year old, we needed to slow down and enjoy some solo time together. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff at this hotel and the cot and extra comforts supplied for our daughter were really fantastic. Our room was spacious and extremely comfortable. We were peeved that a hotel of this calibre and this expense would charge extra for wifi when you can get it free from any old coffee shop around town. This should be included. As for most hotels of this level, the snacks and drinks prices in the room were extortionate. Parking cost £36 per night with valet. Only an extra £11 from doing it yourself; expensive, but worth it I'd suggest. Overall, a very pleasant stay and excellent for our daughter.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly comfortable city centre hotel”
Reviews.Author: manswa
Reviews.Content: We arrived late after over 18 hours travelling from UK. The check-in was fast and efficient. We ordered room service on the first night - it was very good freshly prepared pasta that arrived within 20 minutes. The food was a little expensive but not bad value. Overall, the hotel was incredibly comfortable - well worth the little extra money.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent”
Reviews.Author: burgessca
Reviews.Content: I have always been a fan of Fairmont hotels since my first visit to the original on Nob Hill in San Francisco as a child. Years after, my high school prom was at the Fairmont. Since then, ownership has changed and the Fairmont has grown globally and quickly. I love all the old Canadian Pacific Hotels which have Fairmont's but this is about Seattle. It is still one of the great hotels in the U.S From the doorman Danny to the front desk to the concierge to the pool/workout facility attendant to the hotel restaurant's, everything is friendly, dedicated and perfect. Historically, the Georgian Room has been the finest dining room in Seattle. From deal maker's breakfast to lunch to classic dinner service it is still the grande Dame. For years, I invited my in-laws to Easter Sunday brunch, Mother's Day brunch and a Christmas dinner. Shucker's restaurant is still one of my favorite seafood spots in a city that has many exceptional eateries . The hotel is close to must-see Pike Place Market, the downtown shopping, the business center, the waterfront and the sports stadiums. It's a modern day classic.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont Olympic got her groove back”
Reviews.Author: NYCtraveler1500
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at this hotel since it became a Fairmont years ago, usually two or three times per year - but it had been a full year since my last visit. The service in the past was sometimes hit or miss, and the rooms were nice but the quality of details (like towel quality, housekeeping, or room service) was occassionally lacking. Happy to say it looks like there's been a serious overhaul at the Olympic since my last visit - it was a FANTASTIC week-long stay. Spectacular service from the doormen (though they've always been great) to the bellman, front desk, concierge, restaurant, etc - not one detail was missed anywhere. Good towels, good linens, great water pressure, excellent housekeeping, timely and well-done room service, excellent service in the lovely gym, even excellent laundry and valet services. Everything timely - and on the one occassion that something wasn't perfect (my Internet connection was having trouble) - it was handled literally immediately. This was a very hectic business trip for me and I really couldn't have gotten through it successfully without such exceptional service. I wish there was a hotel like this in every city where I travel. Well done Fairmont. (Note on items selected from the list of hotel services: free Internet is for Fairmont President's Club members (but its free to join that) - and the pool is a small but lovely lap pool.)

Reviews.Title: “Ugly room”
Reviews.Author: hlcsco
Reviews.Content: Great service, beautiful lobby and building, but the room made me feel like I was staying in a mental institution. My "executive suite room" was so ugly! Room 1110. Disgusting. I can tell the service is impeccable her, the outside of the hotel stunning, great location, but the dated and ugly room was such a disappointment. Ick!

Reviews.Title: “Still a gem in the emerald city”
Reviews.Author: sharno
Reviews.Content: Returned to the Olympic and not disappointed. Can't be the location, and the service has been outstanding. Happy hour at Shuckers is one of the best deals in town for great seafood snacks... forget dinner! Only complaint is some of the little expenses that add up: overnight parking, internet usage (sign up for the President's Club to avoid!) and charges in the business office. Otherwise, one happy camper!

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed but great service”
Reviews.Author: Littlefootann
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying the lobby was beautiful. The service staff was wonderful and helpful. We were lucky enough to have only paid $50 for this room which was a deluxe room. I was just not impressed. I could have stayed at the Marriott and gotten the same room. The sink was also dirty. Beds are ok, nothing special. We were on the 8th floor and had a nice view. Walls were thin, could here the people enjoying themselves in the room next to us. They are making an effort to be environmentally friendly though. I like that.

Reviews.Title: “Sleep Sleep Sleep in Seattle!!”
Reviews.Author: dalenilson
Reviews.Content: The only way to sleep in Seattle. Couldn't say enough good things about this hotel, the location is perfect right in the heart of the city, the rooms are great, facilities excellent but the best thing has to be the staff. Everyone was fantastic without exception. The concierage team were so helpful even managing to arrange a tennis match for me whilst i was there. A big thanks must go to Christopher Cho for helping with this! I would recommend this hotel to anyone and if we are back in Seattle, we will definately stay here!! Wouldn't consider anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, bright alternative to the dim "W" across the street”
Reviews.Author: MN_Hope
Reviews.Content: On the previous trip I stayed at the W, just across the street. Their mood lighting was so dim as to be disturbing to me. I booked this time at the Fairmont for about $10 less per night. It was a really nice room, with old-school spacious bathroom but everything beautifully updated. Clean as can be. The soundproofing is so good that I never heard my neighbors once, although the rooms were occupied. The staff was courteous. Couple things for improvement - I had a hard time finding/reaching outlets for my mobile and laptop, and the pillows were hard & uncomfortable. Would have loved a down or down-like cover and pillows. The gym and pool were like a pretty nice health club, not just a stuffy room with a few treadmills. The pool itself was too warm to really enjoy swimming laps, but that's a small thing. You can sit by the pool in the glass atrium, enjoying the sunshine and can order room service there too. Don't miss the Belle Epicurean, the great coffee shop on the street just outside one of the entrances of the hotel. Homemade croissants and pastries that are really exceptional, and a bright, happy space. I'll happily stay here again if the location is convenient to my purpose.

Reviews.Title: “At the Centre of it All”
Reviews.Author: tripstyler
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Olympic is one of those grand hotels that remind you of yesteryear. The Olympic used to be Four Seasons until Fairmont acquired it around 2002. It is the Pacific Northwest's only AAA Five Diamond hotel welcoming the likes of celebrities and 'commoners' alike. This was our second stay, and we'd absolutely stay there again. Best Parts - central location - you can walk anywhere downtown from this hotel - car service - if you don't feel like walking, ask the hotel for a complimentary ride - cookies and milk - when you check-out and get your vehicle from valet, they give you a farewell gift: cookies and milk. - health club - has large indoor pool & hot tub avec semi-retractable roof and great gym - dog-friendliness - hotel is dog friendly. staff are dog friendly. has patch of grass in front of hotel that dogs can use. very convenient. - terrace bar pianist - had some well-priced appies & drinks at the terrace bar whilst listening to the sweet sounds of the pianist. he played one of the best medleys i've ever heard including renditions from Wicked Musical, Seal, Little Mermaid.... - the french cafe (Belle Epicurean) located in the hotel's lower lobby has amazing croissants, a gorgeous espresso machine and bistro decor - the staff. the level of service by everyone we encountered was to the highest standard. we even witnessed a guest disputing with a hotel employee and the staff member was always professional and gracious. Not Ideal - $36 valet parking (this is standard for a city hotel; just feels wrong to pay that amount:) - beds. stayed in a deluxe room but bed was not to that standard. there was a canoe-effect. - certain parts of rooms are lovely (bathroom), but the carpet and furniture look tired. Hints - you can avoid paying $36/night for valet parking by finding a spot on the street. The only catch is that no cars are allowed on the street during 7 - 9am, so you have to get up early and move your vehicle. We did this the first night because we saw street parking right away and wanted to get up early. The second night, we opted for valet. - you can get free internet (and a host of other benefits) if you join fairmont's loyalty program: President's Club

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sunflower7777
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont Seattle for 3 nights. The hotel was centrally located and walking distance to most popular attractions. The hotel was immaculately clean and the employees were extremely accommodating, friendly and helpful. Our favorite part of our stay was the complimentary milk and cookies given to our young son every night. We were very pleased with our stay and with the Fairmont brand in general.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Tea Service”
Reviews.Author: IrishGirl358
Reviews.Content: Having been to the Fairmont Empress in Victoria I had high expectations for this location. How very disappointing it turned out to be. I made reservations for Afternoon Tea on a Sunday after Mothers Day so we wouldn't be crammed in. When we arrived they had us down for lunch, so they seated us and cleared the table around us (very loudly), and then re-set it. After which tea arrived much later than it should have, my sisters tea pot was cold to the touch, and the food was terrible. For what they are charging this should have been a wonderful experience. There are better places for an Afternoon Tea experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, very accommodating and friendly”
Reviews.Author: bahatrip
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in Feb 2010 for a late Valentines getaway. Upon arrival they upgraded us to a deluxe room. It was a very nice with ample room. Nice amenities in the bathroom. The pool/hot tub area looks beautiful now that the remodel is done. We were able to get a great rate so check their site for specials, they offer a "best rate" on their site periodically. We were able to get a great rate on travelzoo. $149/night. Beautiful lobby and the people at the front desk were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “very difficult to work with...........stay away”
Reviews.Author: BIG_SOS
Reviews.Content: My colleagues warned me these people were difficult to work with. Said he would never stay here again. I had the same experience dealing with reservations. Lot's of controversy and discussions on obtaining my corporate rate for vacation. Don't know whether they'll honor it..."at the discretion of the front desk". Well, there are too many good hotels in seattle to deal with that. I'll take my business elsewhere. I'd do the same if I were you.

Reviews.Title: “Valentine Celebration”
Reviews.Author: ramonabare
Reviews.Content: A wonderful time and a great feel to this hotel . Feeling like we were in a time capusle we enjoyed the ambience. Our room was a bit worn, and we were not aware that hotel was under renovation - till the day before our arrival - given that- we enjoyed this Seattle Classic and will have great memories - we spent Saturday nite in the lobby with a drink and a great pianist. Our room was spacious and clean. Customer service is great and I was treated to a plate of choclate covered strawberries , as I was celebrating my Birthday . We enjoyed Sunday Brunch at the Georgian, elegance and liesure - It is possible to stay in Seattle and not leave this hotel- although shopping in the city has to be enjoyed. We live about an hours drive from Seattle so we enjoy an overnite stay in the city, this is one of our best nite's out - I was raised in the Northwest and had always wanted to stay here - I was not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: alaska7133
Reviews.Content: Everything is wonderful. Service in any area of the hotel is wonderful. Everybody cares a lot about what they do.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mblip
Reviews.Content: My wife and I joined a small group from our University on business and leisure. We had a contractual very reasonable rate, plus a complimentary upgrade to a suite and free wireless in room internet (President's Club membership). The hotel was spotless and looked as if it has just been totally refurbished (previously Four Seasons). Our rooms were well furnished and spacious. Bed was comfortable, and HVAC unobtrusive. Service was prompt and gracious. Location was central - Benaroya Symphony Hall is next door, many fine restaurants, Pike Market, and Pioneer Sq just a short walk. We will gladly stay here again on any future visit. Breakfast was expensive. Instead head over to Bacco near Pike Market for outstanding and reasonable Eggs Benedict with dungenous crab. Taxis at the door and easy access to I-5 gets you conveniently and speedily to SEA-TAC airport - or if you are traveling light there is a light rail station a block away for same.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont Olympic-A wonderful change of pace”
Reviews.Author: greenwayplanner
Reviews.Content: I checked into the Fairmont Olympic on Martin Luther King Day for a visit to Seattle. I have always liked the outside architecture of this great hotel, and I wanted to stay here. The service was impeccable, and the staff willing to go the extra mile to accommodate you. We were upgraded to a larger room, with comfortable beds, and a newly updated bathroom. We had an evening drink in the bar in the lobby, and one of the bar staff took us on a tour of the original 1920's dining room and ballroom. Any hotel that will still serve you tea in a teapot and provide you with silver service and a smile is a winner. The concierge services were excellent. The hotel does have British Indian carpeting throughout and is decorated in a more British style, which may not be in keeping with people looking for an edgier feel. But for service, location, and comfort, this is a winner for me. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor for the money”
Reviews.Author: Oaksroad
Reviews.Content: We were charged $40 f0r ONE chocolate martini at Shuckers restaurant! The room was cold and the heat didn't work. The hotel is generally very cold in appearance and attituse. I would not recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service, Great Beds”
Reviews.Author: BCRoadie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the Thanksgiving weekend and were very impressed with the service and location, top notch in both categories. The lobby is impressive to say the least, and it was decorated for Christmas, very nice! The rooms were just okay, ours had an odd shape and the sink dressing area was larger than the bedroom portion. The service was eexceptional, everyone we encountered was helpful, cheerful and available. We were only a 10 minute walk to all the stors you could want, the monorail to Seattle Center and Pike Place Market. If i could think of one negative it would be that the area seemed quiet, that may have been from it being a long weekend. If you are used to staying at a Hyatt, Four Seasons or Intercontinental, you may be disapointed, this is a heriatage hotel and you should want staely elegance rather that new age facilities. We would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL CLOSE TO EVERYTHING”
Reviews.Author: scorpio0568
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from Seattle. We usually stay at the Ritz Carlton. This was our first stay at a Fairmont property. We thought the hotel was great. The rooms were very large, came with robes, in room safe and a pay bar that was very overpriced. However, you could go to the spa and get free bottled water, coffee and tea. The water pressure in the shower was very good and the location was great. We were within walking distance of every attraction and restaurant. The hotel supplied us plenty of umbrellas for the rainy days we had. The best was a limo that was provided free of charge. All the staff were friendly and the rooms were very clean. I would stay there again. Also, the room, work out facility and spa were very nice. I found the staff to be very upbeat and friendly. We never ate in the hotel nor did we have drinks. The lobby is a little stuffy but who really cares? Would recommend the hotel for everybody (families, business, or a romantic weekend). We consider ourselves to be hotel snobs and I really had no complaints about this property.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Elegance in Downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: TX99
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in the heart of Seattle. Easy walking distance to Convention Center, waterfront and lots of restaurants and shopping. The service here was great--everything we asked for was promptly taken care of and the staff remembered our names throughout our stay. The building itself is on older property and is on the National Register of Historic Places. the lobby is very nice and has the feel an older, grand hotel. The rooms are clean and good sized but have an older look to them. We were told that this building used to be the Seattle Four Seasons hotel until Four Seasons built a new property on the water. If modern is your thing, you'd probably rather be there than the Fairmont Olympic. Also, we were a little disappointed that although you can get a massage, there isn't an actual spa. Be sure to try the Apple Fritter French Toast for breakfast. It's amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: WEARECANADIAN
Reviews.Content: An amazing hotel with gracious and very accomodating staff! ( I had written a longer detailed review TA site lost it while I was attempting to Preview it! To summarize: excellant front staff, totally unobtrusive and wonderful maid service, excellant restaurants (Terrace and Shuckers), amazing concierge who are fun, energetic and very helpful. Be sure to ask for a newly renovated room. Location is excellant (LV and Gucci) is out the front door :) We had debated between the Farimont and the FS. I am glad that we made the decision to stay at this property. We plan to return with our children to Seattle and make the Fairmont our hotel of choice. Kudos to a very well run hotel with some really exceptional staff. Happy and safe travels.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Central Hotel in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Beewacker
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Fairmont Olympic Seattle twice in one week and found it to be an exceptional hotel for location and comfortability. We travel a lot at times and like to settle in a hotel for it's comfort, price and location. The Olympic fills these needs and more. The rooms are exceptionally clean and appointed to make you feel comfortable and safe. The halls are bright and the hotel sparkles from the care that is taken to make it comfortable, the bed was one of the most comfortable that I have experienced in a long time. I belong to a health club were I live in the Chicago area and have found the health club in the Olympic to be exceptionally outstanding. The friendly staff greats you with a freindly greating and cold bottle of water. The pool is heated to 86 degrees and has a waterfall feature with a large spa. The locker rooms are large and have a sauna, private locked lockers, all the necessary amenities and even apples in a basket. Couldn't be happier. We went to the Georgean room for breakfast and Schuckers for dinner. For breakfast, we chose the buffet in the Georgean Room. I was like eating in a ballroom. The cereal included home made grenolla and steel cut oatmeal with a choice to add hot bacon, sausage and eggs. It was very good. Dinner in Schuckers was outstanding. We went for "Happy Hour". When we where seated, at 4:30, we were offered the lunch menu in addition to the "Happy Hour" menu. The "Happy Hour" menu included tap pints @ $3 and fresh oysters @ $1. I chose both and was not dissapointed. The beer included local micro's and was excellent. The oysters were amoungst the best that I have had. I selected the salmon form the lunch menu and couldn't have chosen better. The lunch menu includes similar items to the dinner menu but at a lower cost. Located just two blocks away from the hotel is the SAM ( Seattle Art Museum), a place worth the visit. The special exhibits, including local indiginous artist, are excellent. A gem is the SAM Cafe Restaurant. Most museums have improved there eating facilities but the SAM has gone beyond the full mile. Easy acces from the museum and the street level plus the gourmet offerings make it exceptional. Worth the visit, both museum and restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location, great amenities.”
Reviews.Author: Klc312
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel, we had a junior suite with two twin beds, and they are, twin beds. They were small and very uncomfortable, but aside from that the room was fantastic, they bathroom was large, lovely and well lit. The services provide from the hotel were great, the food was great for the banquets and the everyone was really nice. Location was fantastic too! Within easy walking distance of the Paramount and convention center too!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room”
Reviews.Author: Chriscris
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights towards the end of September and had a lovely small suite - I don't know if we were upgraded or if all the rooms are suites - anyway we appreciated it. The courtesy car was excellent - we never had to wait more than a few minutes either leaving the hotel or when we rang them for our return. My only complaint was regarding breakfast. The first day no problem. The second day we were told that we would have to wait 10-15 mins for a table. This would have been acceptable if the restaurant had been busy but in fact it was only half full. There were no tables for 2 ready and obviously the staff were not willing to re-lay one of those already used or alternatively let us sit at one of the several empty tables ready laid for 4 people. We decided not to bother and to have a "free cup of coffee" in the lobby - all the machines were empty although it was not long after 8.00am and another guest told me this was the same for him on the previous 2 days. This was the only unhelpful service we had anywhere in the hotel in our 4 days there but on our final day when we did get a table and order breakfast both courses arrived at once so the hot course had to be eaten before the starter. The actual food, however, was good. I do not know what the service in the restaurant was like for other meals as we decided not to risk it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Concierge Services”
Reviews.Author: Brightdays
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews I was somewhat concerned about our upcoming stay at the hotel. We chose this hotel as it was the location of the seminar we were attending. I must say we were very impressed and had a wonderful stay. The staff was very accomodating . The concierge services were extremely helpful making all our dinner reservations, train reservations and had great suggetions to enjoy our days in Seattle including a day trip to Bainbridge Island and a float plane excursion to the San Juan Islands and whate watching. The hotel's location was perfect and one special touch we truly enjoyed about the hotel was the house car - a slightly stretched Lexus which was available on a first come first serve basis to take us to our destination and also pick us up. Although you could not reserve the car it seemed to be available very often and we were able to take advantage of this rather than taking a cab. Definitely would stay here again when visiting Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “classy, if a bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: gypsybaker
Reviews.Content: We were only in Seattle for one nite on our way from Victoria, BC to Portland, OR and stopped to have lunch the next day with some old friends. I decided to splurge...and, actually, this hotel was only $40 more than the Best Western, which, when we drove by it in the taxi, paled a lot by comparison. I had monitored a good rate for the Olympic with an on-line travel site and just as I was ready to book, it jumped waaaay up! I called the hotel directly and they matched the deal I had in mind...classy. True enough, we had 2 beds and they were pretty small but the room itself was large enough, well appointed, spotless and staff was very informative and helpful. There was even ice in our ice bucket when we arrived! I had an internet emergency the next morning and the really kind & friendly woman in the business center let me know, nicely, that the 1st 15 min. were free to hotel guests...my emergency took maybe 5 min. and they didn't charge me for the printout and I was able to make a local call for free from there (I think it would have been over $1 from my room). We took a short dip in the pool before breakfast and it was an amazing setting...very relaxing. Treated ourselves to a bit of breakfast in The Georgian Room...again perfect. I think I could make staying at Fairmont Hotels a habit!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Voyager28
Reviews.Content: I joined the Fairmont Presidents Club some monthe ago after seeing tips to do so on Tripadvisor.It is free to join. We recieved emails of special offers and booked one of these .This meant that we could book an executive suite at a cheaper rate than we could get anywhere online for a standard room.An excellent tip and you get priority check in and the free loan of sports clothing if you want to use the gym. Very good location and excellent rooms.You can ghave breakfast at any one of a number of cafes near the hotel. We had afternoon tea in the hotel one day which although a bit pricy was a lovely experience.

Reviews.Title: “The Fairmont Olympic Hotel was a great experience”
Reviews.Author: woodgee
Reviews.Content: We stayed in The Fairmont Olympic Hotel for three nights and thoroughly enjoyed the helpfulness and friendly staff. Arriving early in the morning from an overnight flight we were able to book in straiht away which we were extremely grateful. The Hotel is located near all the good restraurants and near Pike Market. We would stay at this Hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Really Disappointing...”
Reviews.Author: Movin4444
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks old, antiquated and tired. We stayed here several years ago when it was a Four Seasons and it looks like nothing has changed. The bar area is uncomfortable and in the middle of the bright, old lobby. Not the kind of place you want to settle in for drinks. We had a upgraded executive suite which had french doors for the bedroom that wouldn't close. Not what we'd expected based on the descriptions. The rooms were clean but dated. We were supposedly in a renovated bathroom but it too seemed old. The location is very convenient to all parts of down with easy on/off I-5. We went to the Seattle Symphony one night which was one block down from the hotel. Super convenient. We stayed here because of the 3rd night free package through Amex Platinum to also get all those add ons which made this stay a "deal" with a good location. I'm not sure how this property is on the Amex list or is a AAA 5 Diamond. There are much, much better places to stay in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Way overated!!! Stayed at better hotels.”
Reviews.Author: Apollocanada
Reviews.Content: Our room contained two "Twin beds" I am 6 ft 2 and over 200 lbs,When I book a room with two beds I don't expect them to be child sized.$20 an hour to use the business centre,to use the internet on antiquated computers?? $36 a night for parking?? $26 for bacon and eggs from room service?? {Includes coffee...lol} Looking out our 9th floor window the outside of this hotel looks like a hospital set in WW2.The Marriott blows this hotel away..free internet room.large suites and modern,was sooo dissapointed we didn't book there for less money. On a positive note,Staff we encountered were friendly and polite here, this hotel does have a grand lobby and restaurant,spa and exercise room are top notch..our room was about 250 square feet, looked like it was last decorated in the 50's,,we passed on the $8.00 bottle of water in our tiny room..lol.

Reviews.Title: “when you bring your wife on a business trip, don't skimp; be happy”
Reviews.Author: GerryinSoCal
Reviews.Content: the law firm I was visiting said that this was very nearby and was the best choice. we took a suite since my wife might be hanging around and I figured it would be a good investment to keep her happy! we enjoyed the huge rooms and the very helpful staff. comfortable bed. room service was puntual and did NOT hang about looking for an extra tip! huge public rooms harken back to the old grand style. we liked the mix of guests, too. some older and many youngish with well-behaved kids. very central to most things and easy walk to waterfront. was certinly not a bagain but how do you price a happy spouse?

Reviews.Title: “Consistent”
Reviews.Author: happycamperNewYork
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely, traditional hotel in an excellent location. The food in both restaurants is very good and the chef is skilled with local ingredients and numerous kinds of fish. BTW, coffee and tea are available early in the morning at the health club on the second floor.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: anthem281
Reviews.Content: I would not have stayed at the Fairmont had it not been for a special internet rate - however the hotel is definitely worth regular price. It truly is a five star experience. The location, service, and experience were amazing.

Reviews.Title: “5 diamond treatment of guests, 5 diamond environment but not a 5 diamond guest room”
Reviews.Author: spartin71
Reviews.Content: Everyone at the Fairmount was courteous and extremely friendly, in a way that does not leave one with the impression that it is due to mandates from an employee handbook, which could make it seem insencere. Doorman (only saw male personnel during my stay serving in that capacity) quick to assist with handling your luggage and parking your car. I would recommend valet parking even at the outrageous price of $36.00 a day. Other nearby parking garages I saw were charging $30.00 as their daily rate, so why not pay the difference to the hotel and let them park and bring your car to you) Fabulous exercise room with the latest equipment well maintained with an excellant indoor pool and spa. Very nice touch providing complementary bottled water and Washington State Red Delicious apples at poolside. Well appointed and maintained men's locker room/shower with plenty of towels and various toiletries. Operating hours of the pool/heath club I believe were weekdays it opened at 5:00 A.M weekdays 6:00 A.M weekends, closing at 10:00 P.M. Quite adequate. We did not dine at either Shuckers or the Georgian which are on the property Both restaurants appeared to be very elegent however, and I have no doubts that the food is quite good. For cheapskates such as myself, Bernard's on Seneca just a block from the hotel would be a fine choice for either breakfast or lunch. I will give the room a 4.5 diamond rating. A 5.0 diamond for service, but a 4 diamond room overall. Details follows: Compliments: My wife and stayed in a deluxe king suite on August 6 and August 7. The room itself, the sleeping area, and bathroom are spotless . Nice touch providing bathrobes for guests. Water pressure in the shower while not great is more than adequate. Complementary daily New York TImes and Seattle Times brought to your doorstep each morning.. Housekeeping filling your ice bucket. daily Very classy indeed. Critical comments: The room is somewhat under furnished. A second armchair and ottoman would have been nice for the wife and myself to use to watch television together . it would be nice to have a coffee maker in the room. There is a nearby Starbucks, (they are on practically every major street downtown, along with a Tully's and Seattle Best Coffee also nearby for those of you that may have issues with Starbucks. Then again, not everyone would want to leave the property to get coffee ( I did, because room service prices are simply outrageous, but then that is SOP at all hotels) Hotel location -Fabulous- University Street station is just a couple of blocks away, which offers subway service to Pioneer Square, Chinatown. Mariners/Seahawks stadium and if I am not mistaken, in December 2009 to Seatac airport. . Seattle's public transportation system does have designated "free zones". ie you can ride public transporation for free with limitations. Please ask the hotel about that upon your arrival Pike's market, several block walk away In conclusion, if you are planning to stay in downtown Seattle, and price is not a consideration , this is the place to stay. At times this year I have noticed this is the most expensive property downtown. If price is an object,( for some of us rooms starting at $300.00+ a night + tax+ parking is simply too much money) watch for specials. Be patient. It will be well worth the time and effort. I'm glad I did.

Reviews.Title: “If Your Hotel Overbooks, This is The Place to Land!”
Reviews.Author: keisha99
Reviews.Content: We were so unhappy to be bumped due to overbooking @ the Seattle Westin (along with several other potential guests we observed being directed to a 'boutique' hotel). I held out for a more family friendly hotel downtown and was thrilled with the hotel we were 'comped', the Fairmont Olympic!
